While it's marginally fun to see these folks again, the narrative is so plodding and unfunny, you lose whatever nostalgic juju you might have for the material.This is so bad that the powers that be should really consider letting this go before any shred of dignity has disapated.There are many specific elements I could comment on, but I don't want to create spoilers, even though there is incongruity in aging, a disastrous cosmic relationship, and paltry few laughs - except for the guy in the theater who was having a 1984 time travel experience.

title: A good movie with a simple but very solid storyline.
text: I may not be the biggest GB fan as I haven't even seen GB Afterlife, (I wasn't interested) but this movie intrigued me a lot more.For me Finn Wolfhard and Paul Rudd carried this movie hard, if only they used Finn Wolfhard more, this movie could have been even better than it already was by a mile.As you already probably know, the OG characters return for this movie and sadly they aren't used the best as they could have been but thats ok because it was still great to see them again in this beautiful franchise.If you are looking for a movie to watch this month and are a somewhat to large GB fan please consider this movie, it was truly a fun and somewhat nostalgic experience that was great.

title: It was pretty boring and only a couple funny parts
text: Besides it being boring and not funny the lazy writing made me angry especially towards the end. I won't spoil it but I suggest you don't spend the time watching it but if you do you'll see for yourself how bad this movie was. The younger girl leading it was no good and the dad, forgot the actors name, is no longer funny. (The actor who plays ant-man and the character from 40 yr old virgin) I feel like I lost my money and will never get that back which is true. Ernest Hudson and the original GB squad were okay but the new young kids are nothing memorable to me. There seems to be absolutely no character development. The main monster is extremely poor and whoever created it did a super bad job and they shouldn't created monsters again.

title: Left me speechless
text: What an masterpiece from Gil Kenan. Just everything about this movie is perfection. The Acting was phenomenal and the Visual Effects were absolutely stunning! The Cast was really good and Paul Rudd did very good in this movie. It was a great balance between comedy and action. The Story was really good and nobody saw end coming. The Wonderfull cinematography left me with goosebumps as also the soundtrack. Dario Marianelli did a great job with this! I can't say enough how much i love this movie. I would rewatch it as often as possible till i have no money left for the cinema tickets. Please watch this masterpiece!

title: A surprisingly fun time!
text: A fun sequel filled with nostalgia and much higher stakes than Ghostbusters Afterlife. Paul Rudd & Kumail Nanjiani are the standouts for me, with the latter delivering an exceptionally funny performance.I would have loved to see more of the "Frozen Empire" though as for a movie marketed and titled about a second ice age, it doesn't really show up for long...I also amen't the biggest fan on the focus on teenage Ghostbusters as the main stars but with the addition of the Original Ghostbusters, Paul Rudd, Carrie Coon & Kumail Nanjiani, it balances out for me!The villains lore and design is fantastic, just wish we could have seen a lot more of it. That's my biggest gripe.Overall this is getting shat on and it doesn't deserve it. Not the best Ghosbusters movie at all but still a fun entry into this iconic franchise.7/10.

title: Slow burn. Some nice nostalgia but ultimately a let down
text: There are some things that need to be left alone. And this franchise is one in my opinion.The all female reboot was dire and thankfully hasn't been continued.Afterlife was a fun romp. This one was too long to get going.far too much talking and nonsense about nothing.Whilst it was nice to see the original cast together, and a nice touch when both the new and the old tackled badness as individual 'family' groups, I was very dissapointed. I really do hope that they leave it here.I'm glad I went to see it, but unlike the first two which I've seen dozens of times, won't be watching this again.

title: Ghostbuster Frozen Empire" served as a solid continuation of the franchise, albeit not reaching the heights of its predecessor, "Afterlife.
text: Ghostbuster Frozen Empire" served as a solid continuation of the franchise, albeit not reaching the heights of its predecessor, "Afterlife," which I thoroughly enjoyed in 2021. While this entry had its strengths, it also struggled with balancing homage to the original films and introducing new elements, resulting in a film that was good but not exceptional.The plot follows the Ghostbusters relocating to New York City and occupying the iconic Firehouse, only to face a new threat unleashed by an ancient artifact, intent on plunging the world into an Ice Age. The movie paid homage to its predecessors, but at times, it felt overstuffed with various plot elements, aiming to please everyone but missing the mark of greatness.The ensemble cast was impressive, featuring familiar faces and new additions, with everyone delivering solid performances. The special effects were top-notch, capturing the essence of the franchise, and the New York City setting added to the nostalgic feel of the film. However, the original cast felt underutilized, and the focus on the younger characters, particularly Podcast, provided the film's highlights.Unfortunately, some aspects of the plot felt forced, particularly the character of Phoebe, whose decisions triggered the events of the film. Her subplot, including a romantic angle with a ghost, felt out of place and detracted from the overall experience. Additionally, the portrayal of the main antagonist, while visually striking, suffered from limited screen time.Despite these shortcomings, "Ghostbuster Frozen Empire" introduced intriguing new ghostbusting technology and showcased some cool ideas. While it may not have reached its full potential, it still offered an entertaining experience for fans of the franchise.

title: Unexpected Watch.
text:
The build up to this movie was better than the actual movie. My date and i were Originally planning on watching Immaculate but 10min into the movie, someone pulled the fire alarm and the whole theater had to be evacuated. Eventually they let us back inside and my date and i decided to watch this movie instead. The first 75% of the movie was kinda entertaining but once the third act came around, the movie fell flat on its face. (This movie has a lot of unnecessary sex jokes)
I had a great time with my date but the movie itself was below average.I recommend this movie for the Ghostbusters fans because of the fan service it provides but if i was the average movie goer, i would skip this one.

title: Getting the franchise back on track...
text: I wasn't really in any particular rush to get to sit down and watch the 2024 movie "Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire", but eventually got around to doing so.But color me impressed. I had definitely been missing out on something here.I have to say that Gil Kenan and Jason Reitman brought the franchise back on track, because "Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire" was actually every bit as enjoyable as the 1984 "Ghostbusters" and the 1989 "Ghostbusters II" movies. So thumbs up for accomplishing that; it was quite a feat. I was genuinely and wholeheartedly entertained throughout the course of the 115 minutes that "Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire" ran for.The acting performances in the movie are good. And while Paul Rudd, Carrie Coon, Finn Wolfhard and Mckenna Grace certainly carried the movie well, it was the likes of Bill Murray, Dan Aykroyd and Ernie Hudson that gave the movie its charm and grace, especially since it catered so well to us that grew up with "Ghostbusters" and "Ghostbusters II". Just a shame that Harold Ramis wasn't around for this, and the movie would also have benefitted from having Sigourney Weaver on the cast list once again. And it certainly was also nice to see the likes of Annie Potts and William Atherton returning to reprise their characters. And the movie also brought in Patton Oswalt in a nice role, just a shame that he wasn't given more on-screen time.Visually then "Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire" is great. I really enjoyed the CGI special effects in the movie, because it looked spectacular, and they really worked in a lot of nice details. The CGI effects really brought the ghosts to life on the screen in a memorable manner.If you enjoy the "Ghostbusters" franchise, then you most certainly do not want to miss out on watching director Gil Kenan's 2024 movie "Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire".My rating of "Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire" lands on a seven out of ten stars.

title: A word of warning for those with high expectations...
text: I am a big fan of the original Ghostbusters and a lesser fan of some of the Ghostbuster sequels, but this is one sequel too many! This latest (and hopefully last) sequel has lost much of it's former glory AND fun...The bad: humor is quite personal, I only can share my exeperience and I didnt laugh once. Not even a smirk or a smile! (And I laughed my head off with the original, just saying...)More bad: yes, we do get to see a bit of the old Ghostbusters crew, but the original Ghostbusters crew are more in a supporting role now and Bill Murray's role was so small that I wondered why he even joined this sequel in the first place.What we do get to see a lot of are a bunch of unknown young actors who cannot replace the excuberance and wit of Bill Murray and Dan Akroyd in their younger years.BEWARE all you original Ghostbuster fans, this movie will be disappointing if your expectations are high. I would never dare recommend it to any of the fans of the original. You have been warned!!!To all the other youngsters out there who have never seen the original Ghostbusters, my first advice would be to NOT watch this latest sequel, but instead watch the brilliant and hilariously funny original Ghostbusters from 1984!

title: It's Ghostbusters
text: This isn't getting great reviews and I fail to see why. Probably because it's not serious enough for movie critics these days.Listen, this is entertainment, when I go to the cinema I want to escape real life and be entertained and you will be entertained. The new cast are doing great and the old cast look like they're having a blast joining in.There is nostalgia with a few old faces turning up and I loved that. I introduced my young 8 & 9 daughters to the original Ghostbusters last year and they love it. We watched afterlife and they really enjoyed that so naturally we went to see this and we all enjoyed.

title: Pandering Ghostbusters
text: Overall the film isn't bad but its nothing good.There is too much pandering to a certain audience.I see this a lot in cinema and art but and i like this. Not sure i want to see it in a Ghostbusters movie.Im sure initial reviews will be high, coming from a certain demographicThe film is ok but lacks originality ( obviously )Its an ok film but i'm not sure i want to be force-fed sentimentality behind a teenage love affair.Lets move on and produce original stories. Stop clinging on to the past.. please.I loved the OG Ghostbusters, I watched it at the cinema on opening night. Bill Murray became a hero. If only Bill could be free to be off script, or anyone for that matter.This panders, and not just to fans, it panders to....I must admit however they do a good job of handling a homosexual relationship ' based on love ' .Lacks heart 6/10.

title: A Slight Improvement on a Mediocre Movie
text: I barely even want to talk about this nothing burger of a movie; a hand wave might suffice as a review here. Watch it if you want; I am not going to stop you. Or don't; it's also kind of a waste of time. I should say that the film is an improvement over Afterlife in many ways; it's slightly funnier, a bit more well structured, and uses its ideas a little better. The damnation by faint praise is intentional; slightly more than the bare minimum is still not a good thing.It's okay. It's okay as okay comes. Afterlife was "almost not okay," and now this one is "okay."It's very disappointing to see a horror comedy that barely makes you laugh and never makes you scared. And don't give me some crap about how I'm not a kid anymore and pg13 this or you're older now that: go watch The House With the Clock in Its Walls. It's not a perfect or great movie. But it is more than good enough; it's funny, it's scary, and it is for kids. And I still remember it years after watching it, which definitely won't the be the case for Frozen Empire years from now.What is very disappointing about all of this is that Ghostbusters 2 shouldn't be a hard film to write. The first one is about, to distill the film greatly, entrepreneurs creating a new kind of business. Basically, they're the first exterminators in town. The next Ghostbusters movie obviously should have been about that business becoming bigger somehow, someway- there a billion directions you could take it. But Hollywood always does the dumb thing where the Ghostbusters start back from square one, and fight a new, overhyped villain. Can't we get beyond this and finally see a world where Ghostbusters are commonplace someway somehow? Frozen Empire wants to show you a bunch of stuff you have already seen but with a new snow cone flavored villain. Cool, call me back when you have a story.Essentially, every Ghostbusters sequel makes the same exact mistake: Going too big with the ghosts and too small with the Ghostbusters. We don't need or want another new big bad who wants to end the world, but better this time. We want to see the natural expansion of the business created in the first film. Or just something funny and scary.This is as fun as treading water. Scratch that, it's as fun as treading water while you slowly watch the head of the Ghostbusters franchise, once again, disappear below the water line. Call me next time, I'll write you an outline that's better than this entire film in twenty minutes or less.

title: Is there's mistakes... Yes but overall still enjoyable
text: I will be honest it did help watching this movie with my kids as they enjoyed it with both scares and laughs! Is there problems and is it arguable the worst of the main canon 4 films, yes. That being said, it is still enjoyable with some great plot points for the whole family. The larger cast does add confusion and less coherency to the main plot though.I hope this review helps because if you go in thinking it will be like the original Ghostbusters you will be disappointment with retread plot points and problems. If you go in looking for an enjoyable sequel to a fun family series, then you just may enjoy it!

title: Dissapointing Entry to the Ghostbusters world
text: Frozen Empire was just OK. Did have some good moments and a little cast chemistry here and there, but just didn't work overall. I thought Dan Aykroyd had a good character arc and added alot to the movie. But overall it was way too overstuffed. Too many characters and some were left with nothing to do. I like Paul Rudd. He fit for the summer school teacher.. but I just don't buy him as the lead Ghostbuster. And the mom didn't really seem to want to be a Ghostbuster. The story just didn't really make sense or feel justified and even the underlying premise felt forced. I just can't stand when things in the story just don't make sense. It's frustrating. It doesn't have to be perfect.. but at least try! Characters did stuff that just didn't make sense for what has happening in the story. There were still some fun moments, but just didn't work for me. It's a tall order to make a great Ghostbusters movie, but unfortunately Frozen Empire just didn't deliver.

title: A Paul Ruud movie
text: I think PaulRudian can define this movie. Paul Ruud could have his own movie genre already. It's a cool a bit of a loser dad with some comedy, adventure, and politically correct friends. In this case with the Ghostbusters around.I love McKenna in everything and she's great. Always playing the gifted daughter. This movie is no exception. Here she might even be the main character.The friend of the children were not needed, meaning there were too many characters in this movie.The best in all this movie was the fire fighter character. I am very curious what this actor will do next.I wouldn't wacht this movie again. There are too many scare jumps and too little comedy in it.I also need a rest from Paul Rudd playing Paul Rudd.

title: Do it not listen to the reviews of the naysayers
text: Ghostbusters Frozen empire is fun and entertaining from the beginning to the end.Could have used a little more comedy I think so could have used a little deeper plot I think so was there plenty of fan service sure was was there plenty of funny moments sure was.It was exactly the kind of thing the original set out to do it was a fun goofy movie that didn't take itself too seriously and allowed not only the actors but the audience to have a good time without having to wreck their brain without having to try to understand some twisting turning plot that made no sense and all the players are there. I say sit back relax take a load off your mind and enjoy Ghostbusters the Frozen empire.

title: Yawnorama.
text:
If your chief interests in the medium of film are expensive CGI effects, the subject matter involved or the existing lore of a created world or universe, this wafer-thin-scripted borefest may be more in your field of interest than mine.When new entries in decades old franchises, or in many cases, remakes are generated, what some involved fail to comprehend is they are sorely lacking the core ingredients which made the original pieces so great in the first place.In the case of the original Ghostbusters: a fun, fast-moving romp filled with memorable quips, one-liners, scares and great, well written, charismatic characters.As an experiment, watch the original film again, then immediately watch this endless dullness after and you will see a contrast between quality and whatever level of entertainment this passes at.I mean, Paul Rudd's always fun, but here he looks almost as bored as I was, struggling to complete the viewing it required of me to make this an informed, if scathing assessment.Some of the later effects were okay...This might seem an unnecessary use of my time to have typed this unpleasantness, but...
I want to enjoy any film I spend my time watching, especially stuff related to that which I love, I'm just so tired of the attitude that mere association to greatness is enough.The original cast members are wasted too.

title: Great start first few mins, super boring all the rest...
text: I barely dislike movies, specially if they are action movies, and the first few minutes of this one are a great start.I was wondering how it could be that people didn't like it (thinking it'd be most of the movie along those lines)Finish that 1st sequence and the rest of the movie couldn't be more boring. I don't even remember if I've ever yawn on a cinema before, but this time I did, constantly :SI was constantly thinking if the "action" would ever pick up again in this movie and towards the end, it had something slightly better than all the rest of the movie but pretty pretty mediocre. Not much to raise my rating above 2 (with them being lucky for that)Such a wasted opportunity... I would say that you can safely pass this movie on a cinema and save that for anything else, any other movie or whatever else you prefer. You're not going to miss anything at all.BTW, watched it on a massive Xtreme screen, so it was supposed to impress more and that didn't change a bit, boring all along except the movie opening (that was really good!)

title: What a load of rubbish
text: The first few seconds of the movie held some promise but then it all went downhill with The usual predictable stupidness and unappealing characters who have no charisma.A non credible storyline where a 15 year old girl is going to be the one to save a whole city from a ghostly entity is ridiculous and her bland boring brother who has no appeal at all does not inspire me to even watch.I can't believe people actually like this kind of thing - but then I was only there to support my companion, otherwise I would have walked out, well actually would never have been there in the first place. Awful awful ....

title: Ghostbusters: Phoebe's Reinstatement - Good Story, Horrible Plot
text: Really was surprised by how much potential this story had. Could have nailed so much nostalgia and created an extremely impressive script had it not been for a sidetracked plot.The film focused a lot on the B-plot of female Harry Potter (Phoebe) and her ghastly crush (Melody), instead of elaborating on the main plot or development of Nadeem (you know, a crucial character in the film).For a Ghostbusters film, it was critical to focus on the story of the main 4 Ghostbuster's and their family relationship, but mostly expand more on the lore of the poltergeists or Nadeem and his role. It ended up being less of "Frozen Empire" and more of "Ghostbusters: Phoebe's Reinstatement".Score and Visuals were good. I particularly enjoyed the visual design of the poltergeists, especially the primarily featured one.Overall, the film had potential to be a 8.5 or 9/10, but ended up being bland mostly due to a secondary plot which took precedence over the story, leaving everything in the main plot to be resolved with convince and not good writing.

title: Can I tell you something else? Something important? Bustin' Makes Me Feel Good!
text: Ghostbusters Frozen Empire gives the audience another look into the Ghostbusters universe. The movie follows original Ghostbuster Egon Spengler's decedents previously introduced in Ghostbusters Afterlife with a fun story line that is both new and familiar. The film also finally answers fans desire for a Ghostbusters film that's influenced by the animated series. We know Ghostbusters (1984) & Ghostbusters 2 (1989) are canon in this universe but it is still unclear if the animated series is also canon. While no film could hold up to the original film, Frozen Empire is a humorous, spooky, and fun continuation of the Ghostbusters universe that fans will love.

title: Laughable Ghostbusters
text: As the movie unfolded, I found myself initially puzzled. Transitioning Ghostbusters from Oklahoma to New York with a new cast felt abrupt. The inclusion of a mom, a teacher, and two teenagers as Ghostbusters seemed jarring; there was a missed opportunity for character development through a time skip. Among the cast, the strongest performances came from Dan Aykroyd, Patton Oswalt, and Bill Murray. However, the film deviated from its plot with excessive exposition scenes, leading to dull moments. The villain's delayed reveal and limited screen time left the climax feeling anticlimactic. The writing felt lackluster, the comedy fell flat, and the portrayal of Igon's daughter as an annoyance was disappointing. Overall, these flaws made the movie feel laughably boring for a Ghostbusters installment.

title: Not a family movie
text: Pains me to say this, but it was not great, only ok. I like all Ghostbusters movies except the stupid-humor one which was a disaster.This latest one, (slight spoiler) between the teenage love with a poltergeist, and the constant use of phases and words that simply took away from the fun-feel, their intention of this movie is pure Hollywood looking for edgy scenes.The story, meh. Was really good to see the original cast again and of course Echo 1.Seen it once. Would be ok with never seeing it again.The end scene, during the credit, was funny.If they confine making these, going forward with the ususl social justice Hollywood track, it will be the last I bother wasting money on.

title: We had a lot of fun!
text: Ghostbusters Frozen Empire isn't perfect, it feels a bit long in the first half as it introduces a few new characters and the showdown is a bit rushed, but all in all it has everything you could want from a Ghostbusters movie. The jokes are on point, Ecto-1 and the Firehouse have enough screentime and the old guard doesn't miss out either and lands a few decent lines. Nevertheless, the nice family story about the Spenglers is continued, which shows the problems of adolescent teenagers without making it too dramatic. In any case, there's plenty of fun to be had and I think the LGBTQ community will also get their money's worth from Phoebe's storyline without it being too over the top.The movie has more action and comedy and a little less family stuff than its predecessor and I think it's a solid start for a new and younger Ghostbusters team and a nice revival of the franchise.

title: All the worse of legacy sequels in one
text:
After watching all the Ghostbusters movies recently and then just off of Afterlife, I had hope, or at least I wanted to have hope. But Frozen Empire turns into another disappointment.Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire has all the bad tropes that haunt almost every single legacy sequel. A new character who has great power but doesn't know of its existence until just now, and within minutes, they master it, check. A character who from the movie before was actually intelligent is then now making horrible decisions, check. Old beloved franchise favorites who are there for the nostalgia bait and nothing more, check. Then, of a course, a new evil villain who promises to bring about the world's destruction but is defeated almost immediately, check.This film does absolutely nothing new and is nowhere near as endearing, as fun, or as funny as past Ghostbusters films or its far superior predecessor Ghostbusters: Afterlife.The writing is boring, the story is dumb, the jokes are horrible, the acting is good, and the cast they do their best but with this material, there's really not much that can be done. The cinematography and cgi are good enough it's not terrible, and it's not great.There are just so many issues with this film, subplots that are ridiculous and not necessary. Then, the culmination of this mess is just a joke. This new villain who has been built up to be a new menacing force only to be defeated within minutes of his arrival.Finally, this film tries so hard to convince us of its grand scope, but in reality, the scale here is extremely small. Then everything ends in the Ghostbusters firehouse? This new villain seeks to destroy the world and has already unleashed a ton of new ghosts, but he just has to make a stop at the firehouse first? He's already proven the Ghostbusters couldn't touch him, so why bother with them just destroy the world as planned.There are so many other things I could bash on, but I feel that would spoil certain aspects of the film.Anyway, Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire is a very unfortunate disappointment. Especially for me as a new Ghostbusters fan. It's sad to see such a fun franchise be brought down to this.This disappointing year continues. If Kingdom of the Planet of the Apes disappoints, then I may just die.IMDb: 3/10
Letterboxd: 2/5Watched in Theaters.

title: YAWN. Boring plot relying on CGI to move the movie. Even worse than 2016. Terrible writing.
text: Cast: Bill Murray and the original cast members. Annie Potts looks the same as she did decades ago, and is still a spitfire. Murray is funny and one of the few bright spots in the movie. Akyroyd needed someone to be his funny man so he could be the straight one, but was okay. Ernie Hudson is excellent as always. My one laugh was when William Atherton came on the scene - smart choice! Finn Wolfhard has a few good lines and brings some believability to the movie. Kumail Nanjiani overacts, but it's meant to be ridiculous so it works. I don't know why the writers didn't use someone as funny as Paul Rudd to deliver comedic lines. Instead, he's wimpy and uncharacteristically underutilized. The main actress (McKenna Grace) might be good at her craft, but she's written as an angry EMO teen - wholly unlikeable throughout the entire movie. Cringeworthy scenes that I just wanted to be over. Carrie Coon, a really good actress, is completely wasted here with few lines and none of them good. Celeste O'Connor is the token black girl with inappropriate sexual comments and first-year student acting.CGI for the ghosts - mostly well done except, regrettably, the MAIN ghost. He looks like a nightmarish Tim Burton character; more demon than ghost.The plot is horribly slow and people in the theater were playing games on their phones during the last half of the movie. There are too long diatribes that had no apparent purpose and little actual action. Where's the humor? I laughed 1 time and smiled fewer than a half dozen times. What did the movie want to be? It certainly wasn't a comedy.Overall, it could have been good, but relied far too heavily on the special effects at the expense of the writing. The three stars are for those actors who did the best they could with a dog of a script.

title: Why?
text: GFE was as disappointing as I had thought Afterlife would be.The plot in Afterlife was ok, the new characters were introduced rather smartly, and the new location fitted in quite well.GFE gets it all wrong from literally the first second.Quite how did the family go from Oklahoma to becoming full-time ghostbusters in NYC, we'll never know.Phoebe has apparently dropped out of school and has gone from nerdy teenager to whiny, annoying, well, teenager. Her mother is always on her back, but it's okay for her to stay out at night in Manhattan and play chess. Phoebe from Afterlife was quirky and fun; every appearance of Phoebe from GFE after five minutes is just cringeworthy. Makes Podcast tolerable.Nadeem: I'm not sure why he is there. Can't be for comic relief because about 90% of his jokes are hit-and-miss. Just because he's camp doesn't make him funny.Goraka: Mr Freeze sounded awkward in the first place but they made him scary enough. Just wish we would have seen more of him. Oh wait, we needed more screen time for the Phoebe-Melody thing.Melody: Ghostbusters meets Ghost, and not in a good way.The original crew: Winston and Ray are ok, but I thought Venkman was brought in for no apparent reason than, well, be there.All in all, a physically painful experience, although I was sitting in a brand new cinema, with comfortable seats and a well-behaved audience. How anyone who is a fan of GB 1 & 2 can enjoy this is beyond me.

title: Ghostbusters for a new generation
text: Surprised at the low scores here being around for the first movies I get major enjoyment from the old cast returning and major enjoyment for my kids enjoying ghostbusters for the first time as a new generation with everything that goes with it . I thought it was a great family friendly movie yes us older lot will moan it's not like the originals but kids getting to experience ghostbusters the first time I enjoyed it with my kids keep bringing in the old cast that are usually ignored in remakes and newer films this works to ghostbusters credit and wished more movies didn't ignore the first ones, keep them ghostbusters movies coming.

title: Feels like a cluttered room, you know there's some good stuff in there but you're going to have to dig to find it.
text: Much like the ghosts in these films this franchise feels stuck between the past and the new.In one sense you have this new team of ghostbusters that were introduced in the previous film Afterlife whilst at the same time you also have the original team all on the same job. This for me caused the film to have two major problems, one being that most of the screen time is dominated by 2/3 characters whilst the others sit in the background. Secondly the villain doesn't seem powerful enough to be a fitting opponent to both teams of ghostbusters. I'll go into each a bit more later on but for now let's talk about the franchise as whole. Personally it's not a franchise I have any real love for but I appreciate a lot of people do, this seems odd to me as from what I can gather the general consensus is that only the first film is universally loved. Despite the mixed reception the rest of the films seem to get they all seem to do fairly well at the box office and I'll be honest I'm not sure why that is. Is it because the likes of Bill Murray and co are still such a box office pull even for younger audiences or is it simply a franchise people have nostalgia for?I can't decide but being that it seems inevitable that there will be more films following Frozen Empire where will this franchise go?It either stays as it is a cluttered mess that has mixed reviews or takes the chance and goes it alone without the original team but what affect would that have on the box office numbers? It's a conundrum indeed.As I briefly mentioned before, the first issue I had with the film was its underuse of certain characters. To give specifics would be going into spoiler territory but the story itself centres mainly around one of the new team and one of the original team members. The rest of the characters are just there because hey they've been ghostbusters in the past so that means they have to appear in every follow up film right?I dread to think how much they payed Bill Murray to appear in this.Despite the already large number of characters the film decides to add two new characters the enjoyable if surprising inclusion of comedian James Acaster as a ghost technician. As well as the introduction of Kumail NanJiani who has a much larger role to play than James and is essentially the films comic relief character. I found Kumail's character to be largely annoying but his character seemed to be going down well with younger audience members at least in my showing anyway.The second major issue is the films villain. It does a half decent job of building up the villain and their capabilities to cause havoc but when it came down to it I was massively underwhelmed. In fact overall the film was lacking in general ghostbusting action, the opening sequence is about the best action sequence throughout the runtime. I have to feel this again is largely down to their being too many hero characters. No matter how seemingly big, bad or scary the villain could have been it would have been hard for them not to be outnumber by just the sheer amount of 'good' characters.I feel like I've dogged on this film but I just feel the franchise as a whole is overhyped. It's not an out and out bad film and I think it's one than younger audiences in particular will have a good time with. For me however it was just a bit meh and I wouldn't watch it again.

title: I was so disappointed.
text: I found this movie so slow, boring, script is rubbish, casting is boring, story was so just.. meh! It gave me Casper the friendly ghost vibes. Also, the contrast between the older well known legendary actors and the new cast, is huge! Where are the characters? Where are the Bill Murray's, the Dan Ackroyd from the new generations? It's the same with most new movies, sure there's some decent actors, but where are the new jack blacks? Jim Carey's? Will Farrells etc etc? Script writing, casting, decent storylines all seem to have gone out of the window. This movie could havd been half the time and a lot better than it was if they had cut out all of the slow boring pointless bits! Also, much better to possess a human character than a silly ghost girl... hardly any ghost scenes, zero mystery.. just... long and boring. SUCH a shame for such an iconic franchise.

title: Great fun
text: Very entertaining and good moments. Cast are brilliant and some surprisingly funny guest stars. Would recommend for fans old and new. Great to see Dan A get so much screen time.Some of the pathos is a bit hammy and feels a bit uneven at times, but that's a very small criticism in what is essentially a movie setting out to be fun.I hope this brings more sequels as it sets up the franchise for many more installments. The balance of humour and story is well managed and my children absolutely loved watching it.Also good to see Ghostbusters II finally referenced as that makes it definitely cannon now!

title: Better than the last two, but still too many kids.
text: This movie has possibilities. Story was okay, Directing was okay. Production values are through the roof, but what big studio movie isn't nowadays. Like THAT will save a bad movie?My problem is with all the kids involved. Its ridiculous. Nobody brings a 13 year old child on dangerous outings, and they only bring a stupid 18 year old boy if they absolutely have too.No, the original Ghostbuster movies had adults in all the main roles and everyone loved that. Just because I happened to be a kid at the time didn't mean that I wanted to watch other kids. I wanted to watch adults doing awesome things. It was aspirational. I don't go to movies to see myself, I go to them to lose myself in fantasy.Anyway, normally I would give a mediocre by likeable movie like this a 7, but the kids dragged that number down.Stop casting movies by commitee or by demographics. Start casting them like you're trying to create a perfect work of art.

title: Expected Much More!
text: "Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire" is a very easy and rather say weak fourth installment in the Ghostbusters franchise. They tried to hard to make it like the first, adding their own touch to it, but it just didn't work. The pacing wasn't building or didn't have the suspense, and the action was pretty basic. It was so annoying how they had to put a joke in almost every scene, and that so called "humor" they tried to do failed. The visuals was a letdown, especially that over the time Ghostbusters did a good upgrade, not mentioning "Ghostbusters: Afterlife" that I think was one of the best ones, also from the visual side. But no, unfortunately, this was not my cup of tea. A disappointing sequel, and I think they should stop. If Ivan saw this...

title: Lukewarm
text: On the surface, this movie has it all: nostalgia, great cast, ghosts, good special effects, somewhat of a plot... So why is it so average?It takes a long time to get to the point, with 98% of the action restricted to the third act. Familiar characters move this along at a steady pace, with a few favourite ghosts thrown in for good measure (you would have seen them in the trailer, so no surprises there). Nothing shines in this movie, but nothing sucks about it either. It inhabits a comfortable safe zone with everything you'd expect to see, no surprises.Recommended for rainy afternoons with a bucket of buttery popcorn.

title: DONT TRUST THE CRITICS
text: They rated Ghostbusters 2016 over this one and trust me it is nowhere near a bad as that movie. The critics don't know a good and enjoyable movie when it is in-front of them ghostbuster frozen empire was a amazing movie. ( some people may count these as spoilers but I don't ) I am a pretty big ghostbuster fan so I don't really have the best say but I went with my family who don't really watch movies that often and haven't seen ghostbusters (1984) since it came out in cinemas, and they absolutely loved it I do admit I wish I saw a little more into what bill Murray's character ( Peter venkman ) was up to but the movie blended really well showing how the family has bonded more.I recon they did a amazing job with this movie and I hope to god to see more out of this franchise cause it has a lot more potential to achieve I personally rate this movie a 8/10 because I enjoyed it and I actually laughed for once in a movie. Don't listen to the critics go see the movie for yourself.

title: Potential but ruined by an awful script
text: I watched even though the reviews were bad because the previous ghostbusters wasn't too bad. This one deserves the bad reviews. A lot of the jokes fall flat and the script is pretty weak, also some of the acting seamed to be phoned in and felt quite unenthusiastic. It was a bit of a chore to make it through the whole movie, the special effects did help the movie be a little bit interesting to watch but overall I was surprised how lame it was. I was also surprised at how much nostalgia they tried to force into this movie as though it was a concerted effort. If they make another sequel and I watch it I will have super low expectations.

title: Nickelodeon Would Have Done It Better
text: The previous Ghostbusters was a better story. This movie just revolves around a 15yr old teenager with family issues. Not a Harold Ramis type of movie. I thought, based on the previous movie, it would evolved into a more mature comical story, maybe more horrifying. It's was just a Nickelodeon kids movie. Some parts were funny but that was only the best part, and brought back a couple of more characters from the original, but noting too exciting. One too many teenage actors in the movie. I wouldn't recommend it. Unless you have a teenage kid who wants to see it. Seems that it was made just for them.

title: Great movie to play to have background sound
text: The story is very bland with too many characters. The originals had one plot while this one tried with too many that makes you lose interest real quick. I still don't get why they are ghostinbusting if they are not getting paid or how they get the calls. I also think the original character was brought to entice you to watch the movie but the characters added nothing other than a cameo. The visuals are amazing though so it's good to let it run and when you hear the action come watch. Hollywood keeps mocking up their franchise as I think this movie could of been a lot better if it didn't have such a weak storyline.

title: Lost one for smelting bronze in a pan
text: The title covers my one complaint, I wouldn't actually doc it a star for that though. The real reason it gets a 9 instead of a 10 is it just doesn't quite hit the high of the original. That being said, the course corrections made after the horrible 2016 movie has brought Ghost Busters back to form. This movie captures the charm of the originals and while continuing to develop a new cast to carry on the torch.The villain is simple yet menacing. The effects are nice, but in that distinctive ghost busters style. The comedy is on point yet recognizably similar to that school boy nerd humor that made the original so relatable. You can tell that this movie was made first and foremost to be a ghost busters movie and not a preachy ghost busters knock off. The icing on the cake is that by avoiding the preachy nonsense that modern Hollywood is building into it's films nowadays, we were able to get a movie that does diversity right without sacrificing what made the original films great.

title: The Ghosts are so Busted...
text: When "Ghostbusters: afterlife" broke out, I was very sceptic...very sceptic. It turned out pretty damn fine and Jason Reitman just did the whole trick with family ties for the movie series and for himself, personally and revived the cult trilogy for another magic touch, making it all special, for the perfect comeback.But greedy Hollywood remains at it is and one magical touch didn't make it, so the lemon needed to be sneezed till it will be dry in a movie that presses all buttons together, to see what will come up better for several audiences. It has a mix that leans heavily on cameos from the original trilogy, turns to a new audience, talks about family, estrange kids and what not.On this type of movie, you get a lot, but actually getting nothing. It starts fresh with a chase in New York and then starts spreading for several directions, like it trying to fish its audience with several story and theme directions. Ghosts? You got to be kidding me. Genre? Let's try a few and see what works.Hollywood is at its peak of trying to reboot, restart of re-invent past success - this movie is a good example of how it is done - backwards. Like start wars revival with a great tribute in the first movie, that was a fan service, with a lot of respect for the past and then...well you know the rest of it. No one wants to touch this thing for another decade.This movie and possible series of movies is and are redundant. Last act is so predictable, first act is so boring and the middle is just...well...a big nothing. Characters pops and goes, Finn Wolfhard is like a decoration and won't miss a sole, if wasn't there. The Oldtimers are coming to punch in and youngsters are not convincing or interesting.Gil Kenan was promoted into the director this time and switched roles with Reitman. Probably for a good reason, from Reitman's side. The story is poorly told, there are too many characters with little bonding time and the whole thing looks taped from fragments of ideas.The ghosts of the past are performing, for a small portion of time, on this movie, but they demonstrate that sometimes we need to lock them deep in the closet and don't let them get out, even for the price of a small success. Cult movies from that kind of type are very hard to reconstruct - better luck on the next time.

title: Surprise kumail is in it playing the same comedic not relief
text: Was super excited to see this, the trailer looked amazing, i've always been a fan of the antipyro powers of absolute zero, and a lich king of sorts. But alas while the frost effects ghost visuals and throw back cast parts were awesome and included in the trailer, i had literally no idea kumail was in this movie until i started watching it and immediately started losing interest with his usual comedic if you can call it that, character. As with anything kumail touches it's not great, and he plays yet again the same character, its a wonder his part wasnt in the trailers, and now i know why, feel like i fell into a trap of what looked like a great movie but ultimately fell short.

title: A big disappointment
text: The movie was advertised as a thrilling action-packed film, with promises of capturing numerous ghosts that were released. However, as a fan of Ghostbusters, I was left feeling disappointed. The film turned out to be rather dull, lacking the expected level of excitement and action. I never do reviews on movies but this one needed my review since I felt disappointed. Finn Wolfhard should not have been cast in this movie. He appeared too mature to convincingly portray an 18-year-old boy, and his comedic performance fell short. His acting was lackluster. Additionally, Mckenna Grace's character had an uninteresting storyline and occupied too much screen time.

title: LOVED IT!!!!!
text: First it was an awesome experience for me since I have been a fan since I was 2 years old and I got to take my 5 yr old for his first movie in the theater so that was awesome! 2nd, as an old school fan of this amazing legacy I LOVED EVERY MINUTE OF IT!If you love Ghostbusters you will love this! I loved Afterlife and this a great continuation of where that ended!To see how they expended the story was amazing and really excited for the future of this franchise!I don't see them ending the franchise as with the new blood there are plenty of stories to be told for the future of the Ghostbusters.Planning on going to go see it again!!!

title: Dreadful insult to the audience intelligence
text: What a dreadful jumble of a movie, terrible acting, script and pacing. The movie was a connection of what they thought would be fan service, but it was predictable and not well integrated.Half the cast did nothing, the guy was as is now usual the useless buffoon and the girl was the inexplicable out of nowhere hero. The guy from stranger things was disposable, the mother was useless even when her daughter was in trouble. The lead actress made weird decisions which made no senseI really hated this movie, it was not enjoyable, funny or entertaining, after 30 minutes I was checking my watch hoping it would end soon.I hope to forget this trash as soon as possible.

title: Bustin' makes me feel good!
text: This movie was awesome. The Nostalgia Factor was amazing. The old new faces they brought back was so pleasing. I have absolutely no complaints about this movie. I know there's people complaining that it's not as great as the original but no movie ever is. That just means that the original still holds up to this day. And I think this one does as well. Frozen Empire had me laughing and smiling the whole way through. I have absolutely no complaints about this movie and I'm already planning to go back and watch it again and again while it's in theaters. This has definitely more than earned its place in my DVD / Blu-ray collection when it comes out. I hope they make another! I'll definitely be there to watch it and show my support if they do.

title: I Expected To Be Fun Even In The Most Cheesy Way, But It Turn Out To Be One Of The Worst Movie Of The Year
text: At least i already expect Madame Web to be awful, but this one i at least expected to be fun even in the most cheesy way, but it turn out to be one of the worst movie of the year, i hate Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire for the most part, and the movie actually start very good and creative with a little bit of event flashback in the year of 1904, and after i watch the whole movie i wish i watch the 1904 plot instead, it is exhausting to watch this 115 minutes film with 90% of it just fills with a lazily and boringly written dialogue, with again boring new side character, a new human ghost character that i don't care at all, cringe cheesy dialogue, it's a complete opposite of fun basically is what i felt for the most of the film, even the original cast couldn't help, it's boring, it's lazy, it's stupid, and it didn't excited me like the previous one (Ghostbusters: Afterlife) which i found surprisingly delightful and emotional continuation, the pacing and editing was bad, there's like 3 million shot of New York City building, i guess the special effects was fine, i like the first 15 minutes, the final battle was ok although again felt rush and still pretty boring, the acting was ok, and i guess in the middle of that whole atrocities there wasn't like a completely awful sequence, it's just mostly boring and uninteresting, i don't know, i'm just being defenseful somehow, and that's it, overall i will still forever see Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire as that one case where somehow Bustin' ghost just doesn't makes me feel good, it makes me bored instead.

title: "Tall, dark and horny at 12 o'clock!"
text: So, throughout the entire movie, it never crossed anyone's mind to use a flamethrower? They just relied on an old lighter and a tiny matchstick.Ghostbusters generally speaking is more fun rather than scares. I've never been a huge Ghostbusters fan; I watched them a lot as a kid but didn't really connect with them. It's strange because I really enjoyed Scooby-Doo.The film lacks the excitement to keep you on the edge of your seat. Even the opening car chase didn't seem as fast or intense. I appreciate that the story's somewhat self-contained, so you don't necessarily need to have seen the previous one, but it still helps. The first act mainly focuses on the characters' everyday lives, but it didn't grab my attention.It's not particularly gripping. The scene where they attempted to extract the ghost from the ball was when it started to interest me, but then it lost my interest again. One positive aspect is that it doesn't feel as long as it actually is, nearly 2 hours.I didn't like that a couple scenes were cut short to maintain a PG-13 rating, like when Phoebe was clearly about to curse. This movie really really felt like it was targeted towards kids. While some family movies are fine, this one felt like a lot had to be toned down to make it suitable for families.The premise is alright, but the movie lacked that spark or magic to make it truly good. It's just a bit underwhelming. I did like the villain, the God ghost; it was quite ominous and scary. Another example of the rating hurting the movie was that the god-ghost could've easily killed the family. He was so powerful and terrifying, literally a god. You know in horror movies when the character you're rooting for is meant to run and you're shouting at the tv for him to run, but he's just moving slowly or stood still, in fear... that's how I felt about the god ghost, like c'mon let's get it moving, let's get it moving bro.They should've destroyed his horns afterwards as well. Some scenes felt unnecessarily prolonged, artificially building suspense. It gave me the same feeling as when a presenter tries too hard to make something exciting by delaying announcing the winner, and overdoing it.The family dynamic subplot wasn't convincingly executed. Despite the plot's scale, the movie doesn't feel epic, nor as fun. It's rather forgettable. I've seen some people say 'don't trust the critics, boo hoo,' but honestly, the movie just isn't great man. It's not terrible, just very forgettable.The credit scene wasn't that great; it was meant to be funny, I think. But almost everyone had already left, either during the movie or as soon as the credits rolled, even parents with their kids. I stayed because I'm currently waiting to watch another movie while writing this review rn. It surprised me because when I tried to think of the movie's redeeming qualities other than the ancient-phantom-god, I thought maybe kids would enjoy it more. I guess not. It feels like something that should've been on Nickelodeon rather than in theaters.

title: I was so excited - then mildly disappointed
text: I love Ghostbusters.I love the original 2 movies with the original cast. Here comes a new movie with at least 4 of the original cast in the trailer. Excitement levels were high.Then it arrived. I went to see it. After 30 minutes I realised I was going to be disappointed.There are too many characters telling a story thats very similar to what we have seen numerous times before. There are a number of new characters that we are supposed to accept with little back story, it was hard to care about them.James Acaster was in it - nice surprise, great to see him in a big movie. Hes playing it very serious, but I think he did a good job.Other characters are introduced.It plods along. And plods. It felt very long. By the time the climax came I didn't really care what happened.Bill Murray looked bored. Dan Ackroyd was under used.Its funny in places, but overly long, and slow.I'm not bothering with any future sequels.There is an after credits scene but I was so underwhelmed I can't remember what it was.

title: Great addition to the Ghostbusters franchise
text: Absolutely great film which is a must see - just remember you're not a child anymore, most of us are in our late 30s. Ghostbusters always has been a film for the youth but some cracking films!So ignore any negative reviews you read, get to the cinema and watch it for yourself, you won't be let down unless you're expecting something which isn't ghostbusters.There are some great scenes, good effects and the storyline is good too. Some funny moments throughout so enjoy the film for what it is and definitely one with GB Afterlife to get the kids into the franchise too. Overall very happy with the final film.

title: Not good
text: I loved Afterlife, loved it. The trailer for Frozen Empire was a pretty good trailer and I was excited. Almost immediately I could tell something was off with pacing and tone. I didn't realize it until the end but this film isn't directed by Reitman's son Jason and it shows. Frozen Empire reminded me of a cross between the 2016 reboot and Afterlife. It's way more kid friendly. The first two thirds are kind of boring. The last act is convoluted and pretty basic. A lack luster finale. I was very disappointed by this entry after being pretty excited by the trailer. This film is a missed opportunity and I can't see the franchise moving forward in it's current state.

title: If there's some strange don't call these guys
text: Where Afterlife was a fun film, this had all the fun(spirit) sucked out and put it the containment chamber. Lots of new characters added meant no one had anything to do. They was very little chemistry between any of them. Very little humour meant the film flatlined after 15 minutes. A plot point that could have lead to a fantastic twist was wasted. Then we have a big bad at the climax that was such a let down. Getting back to the overload of new characters, it spoiled any chance of development of the family dynamics that worked in Afterlife. It's hard to say which of them had the worse story arc so I'm not going to try.

title: For fans old and new
text: Just got out of the first Thursday preshow with my young son and we loved it. It pays tribute to the originals in so many detail oriented ways while continuing the story of the new team and establishing their dynamic and roles in NYC. The villain is scary, manipulative, and almost accomplishes world domination, but the team unites against him with the help of a few supernatural friends to save the day. It's a little fast and character heavy, so they don't have time to deep dive into everything, but it definitely sets up a future for the ghostbusters franchise, which is ultimately what we super fans all want.

title: Please end the franchise!!
text: 1984's 'Ghostbusters' is an excellent example of proper film making. Made 40 years ago, the original 'Ghostbusters' still looks amazing today. Considering how far CGI developed, and made on a budget of $100 million (!!!!), I'm sorry to say 'Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire' looks awful!! I guess most of the budget went towards paying the actors. What happened to Hollywood?Speaking of actors, there are way too many characters in this movie! I mean hell, there were so many that I found it hard keeping track of all of them. There simply was not enough room in one movie for all of these characters. There's plenty of nostalgia here with the return of Dan Aykroyd, Ernie Hudson, Bill Murray, Annie Potts all reprising their original roles. And even Slimer is back! Unfortunately all of them looked out of place in this movie and in my opinion was added simply to pay homage to the original film.'Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire' is a prime example of lazy film making. Some movies look amazing with CGI, but this film truly looks horrible. There are also hardly any practical effects here; everything is CGI. It looks as if the film was shot in a studio with everything being added in post-production. The acting didn't look convincing, the characters were bland and so annoying cracking their silly one-liners, and the premise was...what was it about again...? Enough said!The film is about an orb containing an ancient evil that lands in the possession of the ghostbusters. The orb belonged to Nadeem Razmaadi, whose family owns various artifacts. This character was so obviously based on the Louis Tully character from the original 'Ghostbusters', portrayed by Rick Moranis. Unfortunately, the Nadeem character was not as effective and this shameless copy/paste character was another example of lazy film making/lazy script writing.And then there's 15-year old Phoebe who is banished from being a ghostbuster because she is a minor. She befriends a ghost and this was were they attempted emotional depth, but alas, there was no room for emotion in an often slapstick-filled fantasy comedy.The lion statues coming to life are back, the library ghost is back, oh and look, they're trying to make minions out of mini marshmallow men! Ugh, enough already! By now you've probably already gathered I did not like this movie. In fact, the ONLY film in the 'Ghostbusters' franchise I enjoyed was the original. I also found 'Frozen Empire' utterly forgettable.

title: ðŸ‘» Well, at least it's better than Afterlife. Frozen Empire is a 4/10 in a Regular Screen, 5/10 With 4DX ðŸ‘»
text: Just Got out of a 4DX Screening of Ghostbusters Frozen Empire.Frozen Empire is Far Better than Afterlife, Which Afterlife Actually Destroys itself 2/3rds of the way in with Terrible Nostalgic Plot Choices. Frozen Empire at least doesn't Destroy itself, but the Plotline is just thrown together and the Final Act isn't Explored enough at all and is a missed opportunity. They should of went through the frozen city in 2 separate teams Ghostbusting - 1 Brown Team - 1 Red Team - and then the Final Climactic Battle.If I take away the 4DX Amplification of Everything, Flashing Lightning, Seats Moving, Smoke, Wind, Rain. This Film is a 4/10 or Lower.Positives -ðŸ‘1. The Dialogue is Really Good and Witty throughout almost all of the Film.ðŸ‘2. The Chemistry between most of the Characters was Good to Watch.ðŸ¤·3. The Concept is Interesting........Negatives -ðŸ¤¦ðŸ»1. The Plotline and Concept has potential to be interesting.....but they really don't do a lot with it.ðŸ¤¦ðŸ»2. There's a bit with Phoebe being targeted by the villain to be somehow set free. How & Why? Who knows ðŸ¤·ðŸ™‡3. The Final Climactic last act is a completely missed opportunity for a big sprawling Ghostbusting Battle throughout New York City by the 2 Teams.Overall, At Least it's better than Afterlife Which literally turns into an absolute disaster of a film 2/3rds in.

title: Missing names in the credits
text:
A fun great film .But very sour taste to see name's missing from the credits . Visually the prop dressing and making dept worked tirelessly throughout the making of this film . They are the ones that make it truly happen along with the Riggers the lighting . The Painters, Pract sparks . Stags . Carpenters . Etc .. these are the people on the ground on set working hard , shoulder to shoulder ..For the Art department not to get credited properly is very clumsy and rude indeed.If it wasn't for these Prop Dressers and Modellers .There would be nothing to film on and for the actors to act with or lighting to light or VFX to do anything with .No Proton packs
Not Firehouse not a thing
No Ecto One
No beautiful film ..Without the talented Prop Dressers and modellers this film would not even exist ..
Shame on whom ever made this wrong decision
It should be amended and names like in all films shown for the great work these teams give to the film industry .The joke was to see dozens of VFX names and Orchestra names . Sacrificing
The true makers of the film .

title: Flat, formulaic and forgettable
text: After a lengthy preamble, Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire finally 'starts' around the 45min mark and continues with the exhausted feel of a Jurassic Park sequel until the inevitable showdown at the end. Aside from some hardware upgrades (like remote-controlled and drone-assisted traps) there's nothing new, just 2 hours of generic Ghostbusters content, a token bad guy and even the same concerns regarding overcrowding in the Containment Unit are rehashed. There are a few decent gags and some nostalgia from the first film but no central message - no triumph over adversity, no hero's journey, no character redemption, nothing. Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire could have easily been 20mins shorter for the benefit of younger audiences and serves only to illustrate how combining a good cast with entertaining source material and an ample production budget can still result in a - excuse the pun - lifeless film.

title: Ghostbusters reunion show
text: So this movie starts off with basically a fast and Furious scene which don't get me wrong I love me some cheesey fast movies, but this was child endangerment. I'm half joking, but I was like wait a second these are bad parents. The nostalgia overkill in the first 30 minutes was so dumb. I felt like I was watching a Ghostbusters fan film. The acting is bad, the pacing is bad, the story is boring, too many characters to follow and not enough time. The effects are kind of cool, but again very cheesey. I'm gonna go ahead and give this hot take and I don't think it's really that spicy. Ghostbusters 2016 was a way more enjoyable film with better effects.

title: We Don't Need 10 Ghostbusters
text: The trailer to this seems to have been released years ago which is obviously not the case. But Hollywood does like a long run up and it had to have been the previous year?What we got from the trailer was the world being attacked by some kind of ice ghost which could turn cities into an icicle, but not much else was on offer.Obviously hopes were high based on the previous movie, but much like Ghostbusters 2, this was a bit of a disappointment.The story concerns some kind of super ghost which has been trapped inside a metallic orb, which somehow lands in the lap of the Ghostbusters. Stuff happens and it gets out. No spoilers here.So why isn't this as good as the previous film? Well for one the new Ghostbusters are the entire blended family. Which doesn't seem to fit with the lore, even if it does give Hollywood some licence to discuss blended family "issues". But seriously, this is a Ghostbusters movie so it just doesn't fit. Also Paul Rudd and the mother also being involved doesn't seem to work either, same can be said for the old receptionist. It seems they didn't learn the lesson from the female version they are still trying to shoehorn women into the Ghostbusters overalls. In short there are simply too many Ghostbusters in this movie for there to be enough story and character time for you to care about any of them. We don't need 10 Ghostbusters but that is obviously the DEI box ticking influence.And that is the root of the problem. The narrative doesn't feel cohesive and as others pointed out, feels like a bunch of unrelated set pieces with some fan service added. For instance we see the mini stay pufts a number of times which simply seem free to roam unhindered. Probably because some panel discovered people like them and they can sell them as merch. But like Slimer they add zero to the story.A major disappointment was that if you seen the trailer you have seen the biggest set piece of the movie, in its entirety. While it does have some charm it doesn't have the emotional engagement or even emotional punch of the first. If there is a third some serious thinking has to be done in order to focus on narrowing down the story to the kids and to forget the adult family dynamic drama and DEI inserts. This is supposed to be a kid movie that is good enough for adults to sit through. I am not sure either demographic would be satisfied at having to do so.

title: Not Sure What movie these critics are watching !
text: Im not sure what they watched, or what they expect from a ghostbusters movie but this had it all for me. It was funny, had great effects, great main baddy.. it felt like a ghostbusters movie.. the soundtrack was your typical ghostbusters soundtrack. The new updated proton pack was cool.. all the actors were good. Especially the young girl who plays egons grand daughter. The orginal cast was all great especially dan Aykroyd. There was some great jokes in there. And some really interesting/funny ghosts. A couple old ones from the first movie return. The special effects are a mix of practical and cgi and the look fantastic. Especially the big baddy at the end.. hes bad ass!.. it could have used some extra minutes in my oppinioun i feel they were probably foced to cut it down.. great movie. And great addition to the ghostbuster franchise! Me and my 9 year old daughter both loved it!Its definitely an 8/10 for me and im a life long ghostbuster fan. Im not sure what these other people are watching!

title: Why PG-13? Very, very PG!
text: This wasn't worth enduring the lousy theatre seat & spending the money. Big fan of original Ghostbusters, didn't realize they turned it into a family type movie. Huge difference. Also didn't realize there was another movie I needed to watch first (Afterlife) so there were a few things I didn't know, like was Mom actually married to the Paul Rudd character? Definitely wait to see this on streaming in the comfort of your own living room. I'm still trying to figure out why this movie needed a PG-13 rating. It should've just been rated PG or G, not one reason I could see for the PG-13 rating at all, unless it was just so Bill Murray could show up at the end & take a slug off of a pint of whiskey? If that was it they should've just left that out & went with the PG rating. Pretty disappointing ðŸ˜•

title: It's ok , but some issues
text: As we all know sequels are hard to pull off, and few series have been able to smash it out of the park Empire strikes back, Aliens , Batman Returns are such rare ones. Then there is absolutely train wreck ones *cough* the Marvels and majority of the mcu of late, Val Kilmers Batman, the last three Star Wars movies. Then there are the ok sequels, Hangover 2 is ok but the first one was the better one, Ghostbusters 1 is superior to 2, two was ok but it lacked that initial punch of the first one and Frozen Empire is the same. It has some good bits, some not so good bits and a few pacing issues. Good bits Ray and the gang are in it some funny jokes, the bad bits too much teenage drama and hints of ghost busting without really seeing it (dunno if this is budget related) not enough Bill Murray. Pacing at times was ... teenager drama driven and dragged down the pace. On the whole a good film and that's been hard to say with the tripe pushed out of Hollywood of late, but it lacks that feeling when we saw the good by to Harold in afterlife which was a good and fitting way to send off the one half of the original creator of a beloved movie series. Go see it make your mind up on it but don't expect to be blown out of the water.

title: Fantastic
text: Best movie of the year by far and maybe of the last 2 +. True to the Ghostbusters franchise of old with well placed humor, good to very good acting and a nice storyline. Of The 4 Ghostbusters movies released, I'm willing to say only the original beats it and not by much. The sets were great, the colors and cgi were very cool and everything fit very well together with I, II, and Afterlife. My family and I recommend this highly and believe you will come away as satisfied as we were. Great job to all those responsible for putting this well made, family oriented, entertaining movie together. 9/10 stars.

title: No spark
text: The original Ghostbusters and the sequel where fun, but every sequel since then has been lackluster.Frozen Empire is no exception. It lacks any sense of fum. There are way too many characters ...yes, I'm looking at you Bill Murray, Annie Potts, Ernie Hudson., Celeste. O'Connor and Patton Oswalt...who don't seem to have any reason for being there other than to extend the running time.The plot is threadbare, Paul Rudd comes across as an annoying idiot, Finn. Wolfhard.has nothing to do, except for a silly subplot I think was was written to justify him being in the film and I wanted to kick Phoebe really hard for being a whiny, teen brat.5/10.

title: Terrible remake of an iconic movie
text: I hate the cast, especially McKenna Grace. Such a terrible actress in a horrendous wig. Since when is ghostbusters an "emotional" family bonding movie. Wasted a lot of money for this movie. The actual fight with the supposed most dangerous monster on the planet only lasted for about 10 minutes. Super realistic. He got beaten by a stupid teenager and a nimwit who can't do anything in his life. I don't think I enjoyed even one scene. Also very sad how they made a perfectly usable history behind the nimwit but didn't even use it properly. I definitely don't recommend this movie even though I liked the original one a lot. I regret going to this movie instead of the kung fu panda 4. I hate the director. Thank you for reading. This isn't just my opinion.

title: Watch Out New York, The Ghostbusters Are back!
text: Hands down, I loved this movie!!! My children really enjoyed it also. Watching this was such a nostalgic moment from my childhood brought to life and it will forever be one for my children too. It's great seeing the OG crew along with the new line of ghostbusters. The plot is really good and the new villain is brought to life beautifully. The comedic timing is on point! Watch out New York the Ghostbusters are back! Special shout out to Annie Potts. One of my favorite actresses. Loved seeing her suit up to kick some butt!!! Great family movie with a little adult humor. 10 out of 10 recommend. It's a total thrill ride!!!

title: A real waste of time. Just no funny.
text: OK, I loved the 1st Ghostbusters movie and the original sequel. Great funny movies. As to the current version, it just seems as if it just an attempt for a cash grab. It was nice to see many from the original cast revising their rolls but it just seems like they were going thru the motions, especially Bill Murray. I truly hope the screen play was written AI as at least I could explain how unfunny this movie is. The writers need to learn how to be funny and are not just putting out such non-original crap. I truly hope that the producers will finally let go of this franchise and spend their time looking for good original scripts.

title: Not worth it.
text: I had high hopes for this film, but 5 minutes through, my spouse heard the overwhelming sigh of dissapointment I let out only 15 minutes into afterlife. The cast sucks, they ruined the franchise with the female only respin, only to attempt to recover it with "gender fluidity" in tge laat two films. Its not a fun film to watch, and I didnt enjoy it at all, particularly when you've just paid a substantial sum to watch it with popcorn. If this was on netflix, I wouldnt even have it playing in the background while moving the lawn. Its actually depressing. And I simply cant understand why they continue to undermine films with the wants and expectations of the alphabet people.Overall, the storyline is decent, however ruined by the excessive cast, the attempt to make the girl the main character while having most of the original cast in the film.

title: WOULD BE A 10 IF IT WAS LONGER!
text: All of these critics like Bloody Disgusting, IGN, etc... I understand they have a job to do but do not take their word for it. #Ghostbusters #FrozenEmpire is a lot of fun and worth seeing on the big screen, IMO!As a huge fan, I cannot tell you how long I have been waiting for THIS exact type of movie. Continuing the story with only a passing reference to the past and/or building upon what is already there. A new story, even if based on elements from the long running cartoon series, The Real Ghostbusters.This movie WAS the cartoon come to life. I have ONE real complaint... it wasn't nearly long enough of a movie. I feel there are some story points missing. 1 hour and 55 mins goes VERY very fast. All of a sudden you're in the 3rd act.The movie isn't perfect, and it doesn't have to be.The movie is, of course, not better than the original. NONE of the movies are. They are all good sequels, and this one is no exception.The visuals were the best mix of practical and CGI since... #GhostbustersAfterlife. On a personal note this movie had more of Ecto-1 in it than ANY movie previous, which delights me to no end.Several cast members can be considered to have stolen the show, with a fun surprise at the end, but if I break that down, it will give to much away.So do yourself a favor. If you're into sci-fi/fantasy or specifically Ghostbusters, go see Frozen Empire today!

title: Made for fanboys
text: I love the original Ghostbusters and thought the 2nd one not as good, but entertaining. The 2021 reboot was well done, and a fitting revisit of the franchise. This one, sadly, is a poorly written film that can only be enjoyed by those seeking nostalgia.It could've been good, but tries to do too many things at once. A few good moments were provided by Bill Murray... which might count to 4-5 minutes of screen time? There were so many subplots, besides the end of the world (always, these days), it was truly hard to get into any of it. At the end of the movie, it said "dedicated to Ivan", but more accurately, should've said "dedicated to making some o dat sweet sweet green".

title: Cringe nostalgia, horrible characters and bad CGi
text: This is not the worst movie I have seen, but this entire thing is so cringe that I was in perpetual state of "freezing" throughout the entire movie. Everything is supposed to be fan service but comes off more like a really badly acted and horribly scripted Scooby Do episode. The computer graphics is awful, the sound design abysmal, and the acting is average at best.I suppose the humor is somewhat okay, I even laughed once. And except for the negatives already mentioned the rest is okay, or at least competent.The worst of the movie though is the characters. The main "new" ghostbuster team are all really bad characters and generally badly written. The actors are not very good either, but I cannot blame them too much, it is the writing and the characters themselves which are really bad.I think this is somewhat better than the two previous attempts of rejuvenating this franchise, but that is not saying much. I think if you are 12y and have never seen Ghostbusters before and have a very limited grasp of what a good movie is then you might enjoy this, but for the rest of humanity this is a really bad movie.I give this a generous 3/10 because this is not completely awful and for a laugh or two. But I cannot recommend this nonsense - my cringe-o-meter has never gone higher.

title: Give up the ghost
text: I'm not one for giving negative reviews. I know how hard all of the people work on these productions to get them on the big screen. However, this film felt like it was made for the small screen, a Prime movie at best.The story was so drawn out and I actually felt bored and sorry for the actors. It's content we have all seen before but in a better way and more adventurous. This film felt like it was painting by numbers and even with some small glimmers of the original fun it fell short by quite a large margin.The characters old and new had no grip to them, nothing you could bite into and grab to say I am fixed into this film and want to see the end. I nearly walked out. Maybe straight to streaming would have been better, or was it the original plan, sure felt like it....

title: Garbage ? Maybe.
text: The kinda movie to keep kids quiet. This is the kind of movie that will never been be in top 100 or even 500 of best movies made. Got expriey date to it and it will be forgotten.As an adult it is painfulto watch. The storyline is truly made for younger audiance and it is very easy to predict its ending. There most likely going to be many more stories relating to this to keep on making money not conterbuting to cinema.There is a lot of talking. There are funny moments where you can tell targeted the kids to make them laugh. Overall seeing the old Ghostbusters characters in there is a good touch.

title: Waste of a time
text: The movie is ok for children, but for adults it's boring. Almost all time is just about the evil, and 3 minutes of actions at the end.Weak play from the characters, just not interesting at all. You don't care about the people because the stipidest they are - the greater heroes they became. Very predictable ending of the movie, no action at all during the movie. You just sleeping until time X, and then few minutes of obvious victory and you are free to go. Again very looooooong victory, like infinite time is given to the main characters, while evil can making a step for 5 minutes, so heroes can be really prepared to the action xD.

title: Seriously don't listen to the negative reviews
text: People are just bitter. Don't listen to the negative reviews. This movie is amazing.
