He need to become a ghost insert in cameos for the future.I'd prefer to watch his camera time optimized for some golden moments, so here's my way to achieve that.Nobody gonna ever re-create 1984's Ivan Reitman ghostbusters but we can sure as hell that there's more to come with these guys.People are saying mostly the same thing, storytelling need more tv time.Sony, Netflix, can you?Next installment: the return of Oscar, Louis, Janozs, Vigo.I'm gonna call!

title: What Was That?
text: I haven't been a big fan of the newer Ghostbuster movies so I was really surprised when I saw the trailer for this one and it looked incredible. I thought they were going for something more darker and impossible to survive from, the way the ice was sticking out everywhere, like how do you escape that? I was intrigued and excited to watch it.And then, I sit through most of the movie wondering when the good stuff was going to happen that I saw in the trailer.And when it did happen, it was so g rated. To me the trailer looked kinda scary but in the movie it wasn't scary at all.Whoever put that trailer together should have made the movie because they did a good job.The movie itself was such a waste of time even for a Ghostbusters film.

title: Gone bust: a finishing experience
text: There is a bit of comedy, a bit of action, a bit of mythological mumbo jumbo, a bit of creepy ghoulies, a bit of nostalgia, and a bit of character development; but there isn't a lot of anything much in 'Frozen Empire'.A franchise built on one famous film, (from 40 years ago now.) a passable but greatly inferior sequel, and a fun kids cartoon series, and a few computer games and tie in paraphernalia doesn't actually seem to have enough ectoplasm to reanimate itself at this stage.'Frozen Empire' can't quite settle in as a 'Ghostbusters' part 4 or as an 'Afterlife' part 2 and certainly not as both. The original cast is too old and the new cast isn't really capable, certainly not with the material they are given to work with. The writing isn't strong enough and there is an obvious issue with finding the right vein of comedy at this point.I quite enjoyed the small measures of goodness on offer here, I'm glad that I went to the cinema to watch but I'm not able to see a further way for this franchise to go.Indeed it's stuck in the wrong time: forty years ago this was fertile ground for a comedy treatment type ghost film: paranormal investigation as an "occupational" was possibly at its most credible and comedy horrors were popular with audiences in the 80's. Why not a comedy ghost film? Four decades later and not only is this franchise old but so is the cultural hinterland that spawned it.I recommend to fans of the 80's Ghostbusters and to fans of McKenna Grace most of all because her character is the undoubted lynchpin of this effort at repossession of a Ghostbusters series. Paul Rudd and Dan Aykroyd get a bit of focus for their characters, but hardly any comedy.I fully commend the first twenty minutes; frankly that contains really quite good dark comedy material with a bit of action, and hokus pocus, and grisly flashes. After that it's rather meagre measures.The acting is passable but the cast don't have much going for them with this writing, the direction is ok in the action sequences but quite basic in character scenes. The production design is mainly a plus with some nice props and sets. The effects are fine with a nice mix of good practical and CGI components. The sound design isn't much in either the effects or the score, which is a terrible shame for a 'Ghostbusters' film: even the basic sound recording and mixing isn't particularly clear!I remember wondering what all the runtime had really amounted to at the end as the credits rolled. I think that a film that either focuses on its new demi god antagonist or on the teenage angsts of the youngest Ghostbusters might have made itself more useful with this runtime. As it stands, some threads for the younger characters are left undeveloped and others are too neatly and tidily wrapped up by the end. Much the same can be said of the main menace character and plot.As for the veterans, there isn't much to say because there isn't much to consider.I rate at 4.5/10 because that first twenty minutes or so was good, and the small doses of merit can't be ignored but this film and this franchise might need to be laid to rest.

title: Humorless and Wasted Opportunity
text: Why do this at all if you're not focus on the gags? Bill Murray, Dank Ackroyd, Jeanie Potts - all comic legends from the original - end up as on-screen memorabilia. I've never seen a director and scriptwriter so blatantly waste Bill Murray like this. Even Paul Rudd, whose got a decent comic career, feels like the furniture.It's got production value, and good special effects, but without the SNL type of one-liners or zingers, this ends up a dry corporate recycling of IP.And what is with the directing? Gil Kenan messed this up. It feels like a lifeless powerpoint.Afterlife was mildly funny. This barely evokes a chuckle. Did everybody on this film forget that the franchise is a comedy franchise? What a wasted opportunity.

title: Crushed it until they didnt
text: "Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire" disappoints despite a phenomenal cast and a promising premise. The inclusion of unnecessary and inappropriate elements like "nipple art" and sex dungeon comments is baffling for a PG-13 film. These choices detract from what could have been an exciting addition to the franchise. The actors give commendable performances, but the script's misguided attempts at edginess overshadow their efforts. Ultimately, the film squanders its potential, leaving fans craving the classic Ghostbusters charm rather than the awkward and misplaced adult humor. If you're watching with your kids just beware. Otherwise the rest of the movie was great u til the moments where it wasn't.

title: Haters gonna hate but I loved it
text: Say what you will about this movie and it's mixed reviews but I had a great time. I enjoyed seeing characters new and old mingling for a.great story. Its a movie about ghostbusting. How Lord of the Rings or Titanic did you think it was gonna be? Just relax and enjoy a great popcorn in a ghost trap movie.If we must get technical where the movie was off was the whole mythos of the protectors and what not introducing Kumali. It seemed forced or weird. But I'm just reading into the plot too much but it just seemed slightly off. Further I would have wished liked more ghostbusting. But it was great.

title: Iconic to moronic in a generation, the sad demise of the Ghostbusters franchise.
text: The original Ghostbusters was an icon of its time and had all the right ingredients for a movie that's still enjoyable decades later. Will anyone want to watch this abysmal effort in a few decades time? I doubt many would want to watch it again at any time, as it lacks everything that made the original a classic.The new young cast are simply awful and all of their acting seems to be completely over the top for no good reason. None of their characters are interesting or in any way engaging and they sadly set the tone for the whole movie, which is equally unengaging.The appearance of some of the original cast is good to see, but they can't rescue the damage done by the new generation. Add in Paul Rudd who seems to play the exact same character, no matter the movie he's in, and you have a rather flat, at times irritating and ultimately disappointing movie, with no pay off in return for the 2 hours you endured it for.The effects are impressive as one would expect, but when that's the only positive you can find in a movie, it demonstrates just how poor it is.I think they should put the franchise to bed, rather than continue with this new cast, as I can't see them being able to create anything worthwhile if they continue on this path.

title: A true Ghostbusters fan will get it
text: I'm 100% convinced I am a Ghostbuster!This film fills you with the feels of the original.As a massive fan of Ghostbusters 1&2 I had high hopes.Gladly........those hopes were met!Storyline involving the main villain is interesting. The set pieces are nostalgic and the special effects are truly awesome.The comedy timing is perfect!Warning.........there are some really freaky scenes and (no spoiler) wait until you see the scene with Phoebe.It freaked me out!Love seeing all the old characters and the Spengler family are now the true heart of the franchise.IGNORE the poor reviews.They aren't true Ghostbusters.......Are you?...........

title: Great new chapter in the continuing Ghostbusters story
text: The movie is a great next chapter in the Ghostbusters story. I recommend going and seeing it in the theater. Good humor - new baddie to fight - interesting-sub plots - new tech - all work great for the story.As for the negative reviews - just, why? No it's not the OG ... and it's very rare that a sequel is better than the first movie in any particular series. Also, those who are put off by the call-backs to the original - you also make no sense, as it would be perfectly normal for the OGs to be involved in any related Ghostbusters activity. People in every day life refer to, and use, past experiences and events in their current life, all the time.

title: I liked it
text: I thought it was better than afterlife, I really like the cold ice look, bill murray and dan akroyd have more screen time than afterlife, plus this movie has a new original villain, these required characters writing these reviews are annoying, geeze, how much do they want me to type here, there's not much I wanna say, just a decent sequel, ok im just going to start making stuff up just to fill out these letters/characters required to post this review, hfjgfjfvjdhjfjgjhffjfjfjyfhjfbjgghjfhjfgghfuutyyfhufghthgdythggjgfhhgfjttghhfjyhgdgiyyjkjdghgryufrutrghgjgdhjftjgbbkyjjgghhkfghhghghhghhhhfjgggg.

title: When the light is green, the world is clean
text: A huge Ghostbusters fan, I went into the theatre with a lot of anticipation. Even tho I think the film was very entertaining, I thought it dragged a bit and they played it a bit too safe. So much so, the ending could have very well played in the middle and the end be more gruesome and extended.The film focused too much on the family dynamics instead of busting ghost. That should have been the focus from begining to end w more and inventive ghosts. Not sure if my expectations were set too high but what can't be denied is that it was a fun and entertaining watch. However, I do feel like something was missing I just can't quiet put my finger on it. I may need a 2nd viewing. I just hope they take more note and learn from reading some of the good as well as the bad reviews because there are useful comments worth thinking about.

title: Best time at the movies since Infinity War
text: So came in with fairly low expectations. Afterlife was good, but kind of slow pacing until the nearly end. This movie however picks up at the excitement level the old one left off. The movie was exciting and fun throughout. I loved the fact that you really got to see what life was like as a Ghostbuster, I loved that the movie expanded the universe, and I loved the casting. Really liked the ensemble style approach too. I also liked it was different from all the other previous movies, particularly with some mystery elements that had us questioning what was going to happen next.Took a single point off because the final scenes felt a little rushed and one small plot point felt a little pushed. Other than that, a fantastic addition to the Ghostbuster franchise.Really a fantastic movie 9/10.

title: I was Born in 1984 Ghostbusters released im now 40 years
text: Ghostbusters Frozen Empire was everything I wanted. I was born in 1984 and that's when first Ghostbusters came out so 40 years later get to see original cast which is retro a classic. I went with 18 of my friends to Vue on 22/03/24. All of us was laughing when we saw Nadeem one dialogues. We're all gonna die. Lol. Nadeem character is original from Pakistan Karachi and thats where we from so if was a proud unexpected moment to see a Pakistan hero fighting with the original cast. Overall the film was brilliant good story, great effects, good plot. Some parts were spooky. Make you jump good family film you can watch with anybody. It was a win win film for anyone who wants to have action and comedy. Forget the negative critics just see for yourself and enjoy ðŸ˜‰ I'm 40 now and great gift watching in cinema with 18 of us family and friends.

title: I love this continuation of Ghostbusters franchise
text: Just saw Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire today and I really loved and enjoyed this movie.I loved it just as much as Ghostbusters (1984), Ghostbusters II (1989) & Ghostbusters: Afterlife (2021).Also it was fun to see the original Ghostbusters (minus Harold Ramis: may he RIP) interact with the new Ghostbusters cast.I really love the new villain in this movie thought he had a neat design for a ghost villain.I got nostalgia with the fact Slimer returned as well as seeing the mini Mr. Stay Puff men again.I can't wait to watch Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire with the other 3 during the Halloween season.

title: The Real Ghostbusters cartoon Live Action!
text: Great fun, lovely movie, this is basically a 2hs long The Real Ghostbusters episode, in the best way possible.Its a nice change of pace to distant itself from Afterlife and all its emotion/nostalgia while remaining true to the previous movies.The only downside if you want its that there are many characters, which can take away a little of the development of the Spengler family, but other than that, those additional characters are well presented, specially Lars, who is a direct nod and tribute to Egon from the Cartoons.Movie is a full steam adventure in the city where it all begun, you will see familiar faces and places. This movie carries the spirit of Ghostbusters and really expand its universe.

title: Notes from a horror junkie
text:
Reviews will always be notes taken while watching the film and have trigger warnings.Notes: way more character depth
Has a punch in the face start.This is an absolutely beautiful film on a lot of levels.Feels very art house and not a big franchise
Way more call backs and other film references than Afterlife and way funnier.They took Phoebe's autism out of her this time.... Damn. She was so iconic that way.There is a post credit scene after the first chunk of credits.Review: 9/10
Potential triggers: n/a, family are but probably way to intense for little kids.Horror style: ghost, comedy.

title: It's okay to like something despite its flaws
text: A blockbuster cast for Ghostbusters to enjoy. The firehouse was already substandard when the boys first moved in and they did a very good job of showing how it continues to fall apart around the current team decades later. At every opportunity the movie shows how aged and dated the GB tech and team are (a major plot point so pay attention), but the message comes through in a heated argument between Ray and Winston, "This is how I want to spend my Golden Years" acknowledging that it's not as good as it once was, it's not keeping up with modernity, and that's OKAY because enjoying the Ghostbusters is a choice that makes us happy! In the final scenes we see the people (audience) still cheering on the Ghostbusters in spite of the initial negative reception. Don't be a Peck, support the Ghostbusters.

title: Sony putting out another great Ghostbusters!
text: Ghostbusters are back! Great movie, look at those critic scores normal people. You know it's a good movie when critics snob their way through a review. Back to the review! We took the family to the movies to see Ghostbusters Frozen Empire and it didn't disappoint. The story was better than the last movie , it was very dark but funny. The kids enjoyed it as well. Parent warning they do curse a few times. My little one said is this a family movie? They said bad words. Also they may have tried to throw a girl on girl relationship with a character in the movie so unnecessary. Hollywood right? Out of touch with reality can't have 2 female characters be friends on screen anymore. Those are my only gripes. Casting was great, a lot of funny one liners. Bill hader is still the funniest. I believe this brought old school and new Ghostbusters fans together while evolving tech and lore. Good job Sony! Eagerly awaiting another Ghostbusters movie.

title: It brings back Ghostbusters: Afterlife vibes!
text: So on Friday, I finally got the check it out and watch Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire. And I was completely excited to see the original cast coming back together, because there won't be any Ghostbusters movies without an original cast like Bill Murray, Dan Akroyd, Ernie Hudson, and glad to see previous cast members from Ghostbusters: Afterlife.Paul Rudd was brilliant with his role and also got some comedy gold with his part, McKenna Grace did a great job as always, Finn Wolfhard did amazing, and Kumail Nanjiani was hilariously great with his part. It definitely brings back the first Ghostbusters vibes, and every ghosts looked fantastic and VFX was really well done.Gil Kenan did a great job as a director, and Jason Reitman did a really great job with his writing and making sure to keep his father Ivan Reitman's filmmaking legacy alive. Ghostbusters will always be a true classic, no matter how many Ghostbusters movies are.8/10.

title: Took a gamble
text: I liked the more serious tone of Ghostbusters Frozen Empire. One of my fond (embarrassing) memories was watching the original as a kid and not realizing that it was supposed to be a comedy, this changed as I got older. I even remember as a real young kid not liking Peter Venkman because he "wasn't taking it seriously" and gravitated towards Egon; this opinion changed over the years too. While I really enjoyed Ghostbusters 2 I do see where it's a paint by numbers sequel. I think Frozen Empire took the bold approach by telling a brand new story, using a completely different formula. The humor is there and fits into the story, which is what I think "tricked me as a kid"

title: Did the critics see the film I Saw?
text:
It was so much better than I thought it would be, I normally mostly agree with critics but not this time. I found it to be very funny. Screw the h8ers!Musings:
Phoebe Spengler is my favourite Ghostbuster and also my favourite depiction of a autistic person, a perfect Grand Daughter to Egon Spengler.Callie Spengler is hot, especially in the jumpsuit.Janine is still hot, especially in the jumpsuit.So, they're setting up a Ghostbusters Cinematic Universe...that probably wont happen!Ray and Winston still have great chemestry after 40 years.It's been 40 years...fuuuuuuuuck!Lars is great.The old ghost effects are so much better than the new effect, a prime example being using the Librarian footage from the first move.I want to see it again!

title: a very enjoybel entery
text: A Movie Review of Ghostbusters Frozen Empire.Firstly, I am a fan of the franchise and have been since I saw the first two in the 1980s. I had always dreamed of seeing a third one. But as more time passed it seemed like a pipe dream, and then we got the ridiculous reboot which to this day I cannot finish. Then Afterlife came out, which I must say gave me chills all over. My favorite character was always Egon Spangler, and the whole of Afterlife was centered around his character which thrilled and chilled me. So, with great anticipation, my wife Lorie and I went to see Frozen Empire, while it didn't have the same emotional impact I felt during After Life, it felt like a ghostbuster film, full of Ecto-1 racing the streets, a big monster, and of course slimmer.I really enjoyed seeing the remaining members of the cast brought back. Even though Murray seemed a little tired and didn't have a lot to do it was fun having him a part of the family reunion. I guess for me the standout was how much Ray, who was played by the original movie creator, and co-writer Dan Aykroyd had to do with the movie. I won't give anything away suffice it to say it brought home that these guys are too old to be running around New York Chasing ghosts, on occasions it got him (Ray) into trouble when he found that old zeal again if only for a brief time. There has been a lot of negative talk about the movie but that usually comes from people wanting to recreate the first one, but time moves on, and the actors are retirement age, and no one can be these great actors. If they were going to keep the franchise alive it's good to see them do it, at least while the originals are still able to be involved. It's a movie worth seeing in theaters and my advice would be when you go don't go expecting to see an 80s movie, but you can expect some feeling that this is a ghostbuster movie complete with some of the 80s still there, i.e. Music and flashbacks. Overall, it should be a fun ride for the ones who "were there" and the ones just catching the ghost craze.

title: Frozen Empire, the next step in the legacy
text: While there are certainly things that could be criticized about the pacing of the film, overall the movie offers a fresh new step in the legacy of Ghostbusters. Paul Rudd's Gary Grooberson is as charming as he was in the first film, as he tries to understand his new role in the Spengler family. Mckenna Grace's Phoebe Spengler is the heir to Egon Spengler's legacy, fighting to prove her worth as a Spengler and as a Ghostbuster. The film ultimately portrays a family trying to live up to the Ghostbuster name, and a teenager who feels entitled to it.The first film showed Phoebe Spengler that she was destined to be a Ghostbuster. This 4th film (in the Ghostbuster cinematic canon) shows Phoebe letting that destiny blind her to the love and care of her family, ultimately leading her to put her trust in a stranger who offers her validation. We'll leave it at that.Most importantly, Frozen Empire offers a new "evil" for the new Ghostbusters to face, while simultaneously utilizing the legacy characters in a loving way, that shows respect to the original two films. While the movie is not perfect, it truly is the next step in the legacy. As long as new and old fans are open to a new era of Ghostbusters, the future looks bright for Phoebe Spengler.Sidenote - I will say Finn Wolfhard's character was under utitlized which is a shame because he's actually a pretty good character. Hope he gets more to do in the next film.Overall, a solid new chapter. Look forward to the next one!

title: The OG's are back
text: The Ghostbusters franchise is facing a decline, with a new movie featuring a ghost that freezes things, similar to Batman's Mr Freeze. This movie is more like Ghostbusters 4 or Ghostbusters 5, with the women of the previous film not being included in the cast. The previous Ghostbusters: Afterlife film was set in small town Oklahoma, not the big city where the story is set. The family of Callie (Carrie Coon), her partner Gary (Paul Rudd), and her kids Trevor (Finn Wolfhard) and Phoebe (Mckenna Grace) move to New York and start up in the ghostbusting business, driving the iconic car and headquartered at the legendary former firehouse. The older generation remains, with Winston (Ernie Hudson), Ray (Dan Aykroyd), Janine (Annie Potts), and Dr Venkman (Bill Murray), who appears to be thinking about something else. The movie has some laughs and an attempt at a queer romance, but lacks real signs of life. The film Ghostbusters begins with a roguish character named Nadeem (Kumail Nanjiani) selling Ray an ancient orb from his late grandmother, which is the only thing stopping humanity from being subjected to the tyrannical rule of the ice-powered phantom. The film features good gags about the Spin Doctors and Mary Todd Lincoln, with Grace playing a sympathetic ghostbuster. New character turns include standup comedian James Acaster in a boffin role and Patton Oswalt in a feisty scholar of the netherworld called Dr Wartzki. Nanjiani brings the most important comedy, bringing the correct spark of humour and subversion. The younger contingent is too wide-eyed and innocent, while the senior class of 1984 is too detached. The time has come for Hollywood to let the Ghostbusters franchise join Jurassic World and Aquaman and think of something new. "Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire" is a 40-year franchise that features four main characters from the original 1984 blockbuster, six from the 2021 Oklahoma-set spinoff, "Ghostbusters: Afterlife," and introduces three new occultists, ghosts, poltergeists, horned phantoms, and miniature marshmallow men. The film asks its fan base if it's ready to release Bill Murray's parapsychologist, Peter Venkman, from haunting the series when his soul isn't in it. "Afterlife" introduces Callie, the estranged daughter of Harold Ramis' Egon Spengler, and her teenage children, Phoebe and Trevor. After the death of their family, the family fended off Gozer's killer, with the help of a high school physics teacher, Gary, two friends, Lucky and Podcast, and the first generation of Ghostbusters, Ray Stantz, Winston Zeddemore, Dr. Venkman, and the sassy secretary, Janine. The film is overstuffed and erratically funny, aiming to entertain fans and explore the world of ghostbusters. "Frozen Empire" is a film that follows the Oklahomies, who move to Manhattan to harpoon wild ghosts from the Ectomobile. The posse meets an ancient languages expert, a paranormal engineer, and an in-over-his-head huckster who inherits a cryptogram with a dangerous plan to unleash a fatal attack of the shivers. The film is an eclectic and enjoyable mix of nonsense, with each scene getting laughs. Characters vanish at key moments and then reappear unexpectedly covered in goo, and the subplots are so gauzy and intangible that it's difficult to determine if they're real. Grace, as Dr. Spengler's geeky granddaughter, plays Grace, who is quirky and cerebral with an intriguing tickle of goth. She could have handled the entire story arc in a kiddie comedy spin on the "Conjuring" franchise, with Phoebe exploring her own attraction to the Great Beyond. The film seems spooked to stray from its touchstones, such as particle streams, the New York Public Library, Slimer and Murray rattling their chains, but reworks them in ways that make us chuckle. For example, tiny maggoty versions of the Stay Puft Marshmallow Man torture each other with cigarette lighters, or Paul Rudd recites the Ghostbusters theme song with sincerity, as if he were convincing his therapist that busting does make him feel good.

title: Loved!
text: Just got back from watching this version of the Ghostbusters and I really loved it seeing 3 of the originals come back for their roles and supporting the new ones was great I really love the Spangler family and the entire premise of the movie kept me wondering what was going to happen next and showcased how no matter what happens when things get crazy you can rely on the Ghostbusters to give you an entertaining and thrilling ride as a movie goer. Would recommend to fans of the franchise as I imagine that they will enjoy it just as much as I did. It's funny, got great effects and an astounding cast..

title: Who you gonna call?
text: This was fantastic and fun, don't listen to people who hate movies, this was perfect. And don't just take my word for it, go watch it for yourself. Readin through the reviews section there was a lot of good things people had to say. For those who rated it poorly, they must not like movies. I do, yes I have issues with remakes, but I have always felt if it was good the first time, why remake it? If it was something poorly done that needs to be remade, go for it. If a story has a great new story, got for it and make a sequel. There were 88 Hopalong Cassidy movies and not all are great, but they are all worth a watch. Don't hate on so.ething till you have watched it, give it a chance.

title: the FNAF movie all over again
text: This is exactly like the FNAF movie all over again were critics bashed the movie but true fans to the series loved it and it became a box office blockbuster this will come out the same way especially since I have seen this movie on the red carpet release it's amazing I can't and won't obviously spoil it for anyone but just take note to not listen to the critics they are coming up with excuses to cover the god awful reboot. But my honest opinions don't listen to the critics and see it for yourself as it is truly amazing and has a lot of heart in it just like the 1st and 2nd movie again the critics are just coming up with excuses to protect the 2016 reboot.

title: Go see it in the theatre!
text: Fun movie! I got dragged to go see this by my wife. After being let down by the 2016 remake, I came in with low expectations and was expecting to be let down, but I was pleasantly surprised! I laughed out loud several times and got quite a few chuckles all throughout the entire movie. It does get serious sometimes but doesn't take itself too seriously which I think is why this movie works so well.The movie relied a lot on special effects and CGI, but I never really felt like what I was watching was phony or overdone, with the exception of Garracka, the main ghost that appears towards the end.But the story moved along at a nice pace. The acting was great, the casting was great. Paul Rudd, Dan Aykroyd and McKenna Grace were fantastic. The plot had depth and never got dull or boring.Go see it in the theatre with a nice sound system and enjoy!

title: Exactly what I hoped!!
text: I loved this! Equal parts nostalgia, character development, action, and fun!! This was so excellent!I love it that some nostalgia was brought into this one. Always fun to see some things that you remember from the first movie. I was a kid when the first one came out and I have to say that this movie was just as fun as the original. I love it that they brought Bill Murray and Dan Ackroyd back in.The first one with the kids was good too, provided some nice history. Now building on that, it provides a nice go forward platform.Awesome they brought back the original cast! A fun family movie!!10 stars all the way!!

title: A classic
text: The new adventure of the Ghostbusters was perfect, I really enjoyed it. After having watched all Ghostbuster movies, several times in fact I always look forward to whatever they are up to. They are based in New York, USA, so it is pretty foreign territory to me, but they give a good viewing of the paranormal dealings. I hope to keep seeing them in the future. Sometimes you really need someone to come over and bust some ghosts, as they are up to all sort of shenanigans. Adorable really, And don't forget to laugh, it is meant to be a comedy, based on scientific research and a lot of cool movie techniques. :D.

title: Another solid entry in the reboot sequels
text: This movie is fun for all ages! My husband, 6 year old and myself all really enjoyed it, and my husband and I agree it was better than Afterlife. The comedic timing was great and Kumail Nanjiani was the perfect addition. Paul Rudd and Carrie Coon have great chemistry without even sharing a kiss. The kids are great, especially McKenna. The addition of the "engineer" characters was lacking a bit. I loved seeing Dan Akyroyd with so much screen time. A few spooky moments made it very exciting, including a fantastic call back to the original Ghostbusters movie. Recommend seeing this one on the big screen!

title: My Daughter and I Loved It!!!
text: This is the film we were hoping for! If you're a fan of the original and AFTERLIFE, you will enjoy this one! It hit all the modern and nostalgic marks, it was full of action, it had a great story, and awesome ghosts! I personally loved the continuity from AFTERLIFE and the original GHOSTBUSTERS, as well as the developing relationships between the newer cast members. The callbacks to the original story were both funny and heartwarming, as well as integrated seamlessly into the newest outing. A lot of familiarity and cool Easter Eggs are throughout the film. They even bring back the theme song by RPJ! ðŸ’šðŸ’š

title: Good special effects and action, a few pacing and story issues
text: The first hour went pretty well, then stsrted checking the watch. There were too many slow spots and overuse of mopey teenagers. Rudd's character seemed one-dimensional and normally I quite like him. Ditto for the Mom. Wasn't convinced about the whole Melody bit, it dragged down the pacing a lot. Akroyd gets a lot of time, Murray very little, but it was nice to see them. The Firestarter character was a nice twist on the old Keymaster/Gatekeeper routine. Would probably give it a 7 except the special effects elevated the show, luckily. Not sure what has gone wrong with film editing these days - less is more! If you like the franchise, though, it's worth seeing.

title: First movie I've seen in the theater since the last one
text: The movie was awesome. All the lore and character development were well placed and thought out, similar to the originals. The old and new characters were well placed together and made sense. It had that comedic stuff with the ghosts but the otherwise serious tone with the main one, similar to Zule. Of course it's not gonna be the same experience as the original but it's not a forced mess either, which is great for any new movie these days. Not sure what people mean by too many characters, there was always branching stuff going on in the original films. Peter wasn't always with Ray and Egon, he kinda always had his own independent angle to the investigative work. Then the relationship between him and Danna. Louis Tulley, Yanosh, and the baby. Seems like somebody wants to stretch for something to complain about. Anyway great movie enjoy!!!.

title: Great Ghostbusters movie!
text: Not really sure why this film has received the luke warm reviews that I have seen or in particular what those writers expected from a Ghostbusters movie!?I found it to be a brilliant, 'popcorn flick' with some great nostalgia thrown in for anyone who grew up with the originals.Great to see the return of the original cast including Walter Peck which really brought back some memories from the 1984 classic.It's not just a film for the oldies either as my 9 year old absolutely loved it too, in fact he gave it "20 out of 10" and called it the "best film he has seen"Definitely one of the better reboots of the 80/90s and one easily enjoyed if you allow yourself to be.

title: Fun flick for family night, made this 40 year old Ghostbuster smile
text: The critics are morons, trust the fan reviews. I've been a Ghostbuster nut since I was a toddler. Is this the perfect GB film? Nope. Was it a ton of fun with a few scares and a few laughs... YEP! They're planting some seeds in this film too continue the series and expand the universe. There was enough fan service to make me nostalgic but not too much to make it a bore (Afterlife was pushing right up against that wall, a little too much fan service). My 10 and 12 year olds loved it, they're already asking to see it again. Go into it expecting to have fun and you'll have a good time. Trust the fans, not the critics.

title: I was entertained...its Ghostbusters!
text: I don't get what some people's expectations are from a film about busting ghosts in NYC, but they need to give their heads a wobble and enjoy the ride.The one thing I would say is that this is probably the darkest and scariest movie in the franchise, which took me by surprise. Its something to think about if you are taking younger family members. They do break it up with comedy moments though.The old guard have been retained again but this is very much about the Spenglers taking up the reigns after the events of Afterlife. I think they've made to get the balance right and I think there is room for more bustin with a new audience that doesn't alienate older fans. Unlike Disney's handling of Star Wars!Overall, a great popcorn flick as its meant to be.

title: Good story, so that is not a rushed out film
text: Giving this an 8/10 ratingGiving this an 8/10. Very strong story and some new faces along with the cast from the last film. Was not rushed out, as you get on these sequel films, so it's not really film that feel pressured to be seen, but worth the trip, as it is very glorious on the big screen.I do write that you do need to see the last film, but, this does hold up on it's own, it has a new twist on the supernatural experience that weaves it's way into the plot very cleverly and if the performances were not rock solid, it would fall on it's face. Many more effects this time around, but again, they drive the film along the right path, not showy at all. With Dune part two still out, we get another great part two film here, showing what cinema can do, with great writing and directing on show.

title: Don't go with the 'critics'
text: Great movie!!You're never going to beat the original so face facts & don't go on expecting that. This is a fantastic film to pass the touch from the original Ghostbusters, to the new Ghostbuster & opens up the possibilities of extending that furtherSome lovely call backs to the original 2 movies, very good story, excellent CGI in this one, & a fantastic castIf you're a fan of the franchise don't listen to what others have said, go in with your own mind & I'll guarantee you will leave happy & satisfied with what you have seen. It's not even close to the level of hate that it has been getting, in fact I really enjoyed it & so will you.

title: Second viewing was even better.
text: My initial viewing I really liked a lot about it but felt maybe a little underwhelmed. Saw it a second time today and liked it even more.The theater today was packed, especially with kids. People were laughing and having a good time and there was lots of clapping and singing at the end.Seems some people didn't like all the fan service and the Gozer storyline in Afterlife. Feel this one gives us something pretty new overall but apparently it doesn't have enough nostalgia and fan service for those same people. It also has too many characters and sub plots for anyone to follow according to a bunch of Facebook reviewers. Yet again those same people say the script is dumbed down for today's audience.I thought Afterlife was a great bridge from the past to the future. Frozen Empire gives us a new start to what else may come. There may be a couple things I could nitpick but nothing big. My only real issue with it it's that it leaves me wanting more.Frozen Empire is number 3 for me right now. But could knock Afterlife down a spot as I feel Frozen Empire is moreover fun rewatch.I'd love a live action series with the new crew. Though I know that won't happen.

title: A very well made film.
text: I feel compelled to write a concise review as I'm shocked at some of what I'm seeing. Each to their own, and you can't expect everyone to like what you do. But this film was so well acted and thought out, you can tell a great deal of care went into the script. I won't include any spoilers, I will say that the inclusion of some beloved characters and the plot of the film was really well constructed. Seeing it in the cinemas is a must. Old school fans may nitpick certain details of the film. But if this is the direction that Ghostbusters is going, I for one can't wait to see what happens next. Looking forward to watching this one again.

title: Good Movie
text: No it's not the original but I'd also not the same age I was then . Nostalgia makes things better . I thought this one was better than Afterlife and so did my family . Everyone I was with enjoyed it and that is definitely a feat. Funny , off beat and scary it was a great movie. I liked that it had a lot of references to the original movie and brought back som of the original actors too. It seemed like it was a little short and could have been a little more developed in places I thought it was good that it made Ghostbusters relatable to a younger generation. I was happy I could bring the whole family to see and enjoy. I am planning to see it again at the movies .

title: overhated
text:
"Ghostbusters - Frozen Empire" is overhated. This fifth Ghostbusters film is a good movie, but everyone hates it: instead, I liked it, so much. In this film I experienced many emotions: there are sad and moving moments, others have amused me a lot, others really excited me. This film focuses a lot on fan service: it tries to refer to many links with previous films and does it very well. Other highlights of the film are the special effects, fabulous and perfect, the music, always beautiful and original, and the characters, excellent, my absolute favorite is Venkman, I love it. I also liked the direction, good, but especially the photography, beautiful. The actors were also good, especially Paul Rudd and Bill Murray. The plot is good and simple and I think it was the best choice, sometimes you don't need the most beautiful plot in the world, but just be logical and sensible. The film is also well written. The antagonist of the film, Garraka, I loved it, menacing and gloomy. The film entertained me the right, in my opinion the duration could be disposed of enough. The setting is beautiful and also the costumes, which give crazy vibes. The ending of the film made me shiver, very emotional. Few movies can give me the same emotions that the Ghostbusters soundtrack can give me. The post-credit scene is nice but I would have expected something less fun and more threatening and incisive. I can't wait to see when the next movie comes out..
Rating: 8.2/10.

title: Chilling, epic and entertaining! The Ghostbusters are back in business! ðŸ‘ðŸ‘
text: To me, this is still the #1 movie of 2024! It's great to have the Ghostbusters back in New York City. Paul Rudd and Carrie Coon still have good chemistry as a couple. McKenna Grace is still awesome and smart as Phoebe. Finn Wolfhard is still awesome as Trevor. It's even great to have Dan, Bill, Ernie and Annie back for this installment in the franchise. Harold Ramis will always be in our hearts. William is back as Walter Peck. It's still true as always, Peck still has no d***. We're even glad to see the mini Stay Puff Marshmallow Men. The best part of all was seeing Slimer again. The film focused on the Spengler family but it usually cuts to the original cast interacting with the others.We know that the first two original films from the 1980's had the goofiness and comedic charm but it also had some of the scary moments. This film had some serious parts just like in Afterlife but both of them still have the comedy and scary parts. Also, this film had a dark tone with the new ghostly villain. This villain is way dark and scary than Gozer and Vigo. The special effects were amazing. I liked the story and plot of this film. We all know that there's always a post apocalyptic moment of the evil ghosts taking over the human/mortal world. There are fans who still like the concept of evil ghosts taking over the world during the apocalypse. It's great to see some of the nostalgia from the 1980's like the original firehouse and the containment unit. Fans who grew up watching the entire franchise showed their kids the first two original films. Probably there are newer generations watching the first two films and catching up with Afterlife and this installment. There is still a whole franchise of merchandising like t-shirts, toys and even video games. Fans definitely want to wear the uniform and proton pack. In every comic con, there are a lot of fans wearing those kind of stuff for Ghostbusters. This franchise definitely dominated the world for fans. The fans want to see more of this franchise because in Afterlife the production passed the torch to a new generation of Ghostbusters. Jason Reitman is probably storming up new ideas of another installment.

title: A Full Ghostbusters Team
text: The Ghostbusters are back to save the world again, and this time they have a full team of people. Zeddemore invested in a team of engineers to maintain the ghost-busting equipment now that Spengler is fully gone.Old and new characters return for an even bigger film now set again in New York City as it should be. The ancient demon Garraka has been unwittingly released from his trap and is hell-bent with frozen revenge.This is once again a fun movie with a full cast that any Ghostbusters fan will enjoy. It is good to see Annie Potts in a uniform to help the team. It is even a good surprise to see William Atherton as the mayor. Many scenes make homage to the first film, even Slimer returns for a few slimes. The only one still missing is Rick Moranis.

title: Ghostbusters
text: It brings back memories when I was young, I used to watch this movie. This show is good for families to watch. I like the part were they are playing chess, it is weird but in a good way. I beleive in spirit and ghost they actually exist in our realm. I am looking forward for the nex installment for this movie, If they can add a scientific side & spiritual side of view that would be better. To better understand the spiritual realm u must have knowledge, The spiritual point of view is yes when you die you will have a spiritual body. Close to the transparent or translucent white figure you see on the movie. I enjoy watching this movie I miss Ghostbuster when I was a kid it's nostalgic.

title: Newest continuation, new generation
text: COntinuing the afterlife movie, the previous ghostbuster, it shows the Spanglers and the old dudes and office manager women from the first three films in franchise which was such a nice commeneration. I thought I would hate it after the first around 15-30mins where it was using the franchise name, the last movie family and using a boy from stranger things to just get the audience to see it because the boy was in it but, they ended up adding new pizzaz to the end, we get new interesting ghost characters along with the green one who eats a bunch of course which was a nice bit to the OG, I think this movie does better than most recent movies (aka, the one with that old man who rules a kingdom, I think it was Wish.)

title: if you love Ghostbusters you'll have a lot of fun- isn't that enough?
text: ... a film series developing not unlike the Mission Impossible franchise- it wants to entertain: the general audience, newcomers & longtime fans alike, & largely succeeds; by amping up the pace from the refresh Afterlife, this latest instalment widens the scope, character development (Paul Rudd is basically Peter Venkman from the cartoon the Real Ghostbusters at this point, like he pretty much always seemed destined to), in universe lore, & satisfyingly includes the classic OGs (including finally upgrading Annie Potts' Janine to full member) in mentorship/backroom but pivotal support roles; its not the original, so it doesn't hit those heights (not sure it's reasonable to consider at this point in the Marvelisation & sad decay of cinema, mainstream especially: what ever could again?), but after the last instalment's dramatic detour to reset, we're back at the firehouse, in NYC, on familiar territory with upgrades & minor tweaks, & it goes out of it's way to entertain, provide gentle, engaging, fun, feel good escapism; everyone who was good last time ups the game, though the cast is larger this time round so some don't have as much screen time as would be as satisfying (the great wee double act of Mckenna Grace & Logan Kim for instance, clearly the future once the reins are fully handed over), Dan Aykroyd shines as his Dr Ray Stantz gets some room to connect (his palpable sense of pride in achievement of finally getting this series back up & running after 30 plus years of trying is heartwarming & infectious- he literally beams in scenes watching the youngster new stars take the lead), & of the newest editions to the cast the real star is Kumail Nanjiani whose understated, laconic, charismatic chops remind of classic era Bill Murray meets Rick Moranis & put the amusement meter a few good clicks higher anytime his character is on screen; fun- remember when we used to be able to have fun? It is allowed you know- a fun, solid movie, the latest instalment of a beloved continuing story, clearly in good, genuinely caring hands once more; honestly don't see what the critic's problem is with escapist enjoyment? They continually hammer nostalgia like it's some kind of entertainment that's beneath them- its part 4 in a multi-film series, the characters in the previous chapters of this on going story still (largely) exist, why wouldn't they make appearances in their own story? They still inhabit it- it is their world after all! If you like Ghostbusters & you want respite from the grimness of the world, & want to be entertained in a simpler universe where good & bad are easily defined, where there's always hope, & good wins out no matter how dark things may seem, then why not make up your own mind? Why not go see something that purely just wants to let you have a good, fun time & enjoy yourself? Exactly, why not- can't wait 'til the next one...

title: Good followup... bigger ending needed though
text: I would say this had a lot of very cool additions to the story and character progression. New technology was cool to see.... and new ghost variants... along with some older favorites. Just wish the ending has a little more scenes with the main evil spirt. I would say it's a must watch in the series, but not the strongest of all of them. Looking forward to the next Ghost Busters movie with the Spieglers and the original cast!!!P. S. If you had children that liked the last one.... Definatly more spooky in some parts for my younger children that were okay with the last one. Although my 8 year old liked it a lot.

title: Nostalgic and fun
text: Love all the throw backs to the original and how they brought in the old team with the new team and redid iconic scenes and iconic location of the original. So much fun. Keep them coming! Thanks Dan A. For keeping the dream and deep connection to the spirit world alive and on screen!Love all the throw backs to the original and how they brought in the old team with the new team and redid iconic scenes and iconic location of the original. So much fun. Keep them coming! Thanks Dan A. For keeping the dream and deep connection to the spirit world alive and on screen!Love all the throw backs to the original and how they brought in the old team with the new team and redid iconic scenes and iconic location of the original. So much fun. Keep them coming! Thanks Dan A. For keeping the dream and deep connection to the spirit world alive and on screen!

title: The Ghostbusters movie ever!!!!
text: Very well made!My son thinks tied with girl Ghostbusters!Super entertaining!Good job guys!!!!!!Everyone should go watch it in Laser Ultra as it has a huge screen very well made movie!Only a couple of adult ish jokes in there and super nice spectacle all should go to watch!!!!Thank you to the original and new cast members you just made our year!Please , please go watch it at least once ! A real gem! Only hundred and sixty seven characters to write so again!Thank you cast! You are awesome! Everyone should watch it at least once and 19 out of 10 or 5 out of 5 or whatever I ly 8 characters to go!See ya!

title: A brilliant sequel, a joyous adventure back in NYC
text: Ghostbusters: Afterlife was a brilliant movie with an excellent cast and plot that continued the story and after 3 years The Spenglers & Co are back at their spiritual home and DNA of the franchise, New York!I thought the plot was 'chillingly' good and the perfect fit to the wider story, great hearing the Ecto-1 whizzing about the streets busting ghosts with something evil on its way...I love that the OG characters have apprised their roles again, it's the perfect antidote with the old / young cast members saving New York together.I love that we see more of the Firehouse, as The Spenglers have took residency with a certain returning character lurking in the attic...The action throughout is just great, lots of humour with some dark moments and lots of references to the first movie and with an old character back as now Mayor of New York 'Walter Peck' still out for the OG crew.Ignore the negative reviews, the direction of the franchise is brilliant, a fun family movie with the feels of a family sit down 80s popcorn adventure, heart warning, action packed and enough scares to leave you feeling well... 'frozen' go see it, won't be disappointed!

title: For kids and old fans, the message is clean
text: When you consider all the evil stereotypes humanity is enduring for the last 4 years, this film ironically comes to the rescue. All actors do an ok job, the music and effects are great, and the best thing is the clean message behind the plot. A healthy family, friends, companions for a good cause, lessons learned on who to trust, and a good ending. This is good! Considering all the evil in Hollywood, this is actually very good. If you are a Ghostbusters fan or someone with kids that needs a clean movie to pass the time, this is one of the few you'll find in 2024. So give it a shot and call Ghostbusters.

title: You are CRAZY if you think this movie isn't GREAT!
text: I really enjoyed it, I don't care about what the critics say, if you love the franchise go and watch it, it's fun and at the end of the day WHO ARE YOU GONNA CALL? I loved it, only wished it was even longer. I wanted more and that's a great feeling. Realistically it's not an Oscar winning film but everyone there left with a smile on their face. Will definitely watch again.It was funny and light hearted scary. I'm a huge fan. It falls in line with the first 2 ghostbusters movies. It doesn't have the emotional tear jerker storyline of the last one. Like every ghostbusters film before this one, an absolutely masterpiece and very cool to see it on the big screen. I loved it very much.

title: A great addition to the franchise.
text: I think the critics are either paid by other studios or they have no.clue, or both.After Ghostbusters 2 which was OK at best but still a guilty pleasure of mine, we had the next best thing that took the adventures.further with the animated serious. Afterlife and Frozen Empire allow us to see Dan Aykroyd, Ernie Hudson and Bill Murray on screen as the Ghostbusters whilst allowing the new breed to continue their legacy.Only thinking missing is Rick Moranis who I hope does get a role in the next movie.This is a great movie, a good story and it was fun.Don't listen to the critics who are clueless.

title: Fantastic Family Film
text: We took our three kids to see this and it turned out to be one of the rare films that satisfied everyone.Ghostbusters belongs in New York, the original cast are deployed in a far more thoughtful fashion and the runtime gives the story more room to breathe.My only criticism is that, while introduced well, the central demonic entity is a fairly unmemorable CGI creation, lacking the humour or originality of the atavistic monsters in the original films.The new cast members shine and the story is well-paced. I would be pleased to see a third film in this series if Ghost Corps can maintain this level of quality.

title: Solid Movie
text: Went and saw Ghostbusters Frozen Empire this weekend. If you are on the fence, just go see it.I wasn't sure what to expect with Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire, but I was pleasantly surprised! The movie had a really well-written script. It was funny and had seriousness at the same time, which is exactly what I look for in a Ghostbusters movie. What I enjoyed most was seeing the new cast, especially McKenna Grace, really coming into their own. The new crew had this great chemistry together, and it felt like they'd grown so much since the last movie. It was also cool to see the original Ghostbusters working alongside them and not stealing the whole show. It truly was a passing of the torch this time. They saw the new crew was ready and that they can enjoy their "Golden Years" from the side and not have to be the front lines anymore. The movie did a great job of balancing nostalgia with fresh new ideas. The new ghosts were creepy and creative, and the gadgets the Ghostbusters used were awesome. Overall, I had a blast watching Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire!

title: Hilarious!
text: I just got back from seeing Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire and I have to say. I don't understand the hate for it. It's absolutely hilarious. The jokes land Paul Rudd and Kumil Nanijani stole the show. It's darker for ghostbusters. It's not quite as good as Afterlife but it is still a thrill ride. I saw in Dolby at AMC and the sound and seats shaking make it much better for entertainment. Everyone was fantastic in the show. My only complaint about the movie is I'm tired of this fire and ice theme. It's been the theme for a lot of movies lately and we need a new theme. I also wish the fight scene was a bit longer. The runtime was 1hr and 55 minutes. Ghostbusters: Afterlife was 2 hrs and 5 minutes. If Frozen Empire was 2 hrs and 10 minutes it would be the perfect length. I recommend this movie. Especially for those who grew up on the originals.

title: Great Ghostbusters movie, now my second favorite
text: So, I was actually starting to dread seeing this Ghostbusters movie after all the hate it's been getting. However, it turned out to be my second favorite Ghostbusters movie, after the first. Everyone I went with felt the same, as well.I liked Ghostbusters Afterlife, but less so after another couple viewings. This one is a huge improvement. It does have quite a few new characters, and sometimes seems to struggle a bit with how to incorporate all its returning characters and the new characters, but at the end for me it pulls it off really well.Also, this film has the most scares and elements of horror (for a Ghostbusters film)of any of the Ghostbusters movies. This Ghostbusters movie treats the supernatural unknown more seriously and menacingly then any of the other Ghostbusters movies.It also incorporates Dan Aykroyd's original fascination (and his father and grandfather before him) with the supernatural and its allure, which was how Ghostbusters came into existence in the first place. At the same time, it embraces the weirdness of the Ghostbusters world, especially, as the filmmakers that intended, touching on elements from the Ghostbusters cartoons, which I grew up on.Very cool movie! Hope it's successful enough for another one to come!

title: Surprised by the low rating - Spoiler free
text: I only just saw Afterlife, though I've always loved the original two Ghostbusters films. A lot has changed in 40 years, and in my opinion I thought there was a perfect blend of tradition and new. I thought the carrying forward of Dr. Spengler's legacy was well done and appropriate. They play on a lot of nostalgia without overdoing it, and using modern technology to keep it fresh and up to date. There's ample humor, but I would easily call this the scariest of the series. Paul Rudd has a moment (we all know the one if we've seen it) that is incredibly cheesy. But I couldn't bring myself to not laugh. They've left it open enough for a new generation of Busters to take over from the legends themselves, and I was very happy with Dan Aykroyd's larger role. I was glad to see Winston and Venkman make their return as well, along with Jeanine. It would have been nice to have the WHOLE gang back together with Louis and Dana, but maybe in the future.All in all a solid continuation of one of my childhood favorites.

title: Ignore critics, loved it!
text: Loved this addition to the ghostbusters franchise, infact id say its the funniest ghostbusters yet, the main enemy garraka is also very scary, however vigo from ghostbusters 2 is still by far the scariest. I disagree with the critics who say theres too many characters, i thought every character braught something to the film. The og ghostbusters was superb also, however would of liked a little more screentime from bill murray and annie potts. Loved how they included little moments of music from the 1st film, the marshmallow and slimer scenes are hilarious, there was a few scenes that slowed the film down and i didnt like the sewer dragon chase as i didnt like the dialogue, it was like they was trying a bit too hard to be funny but it didnt work for me hence why i havent give this a 9 rating, overall tho great funny family film with lots of nostalga, highly reccomended, however as good as this movie is the first 2 from the 80s still lead the franchise for me, but thoroughly enjoyed this movie.

title: Answer the Frozen Call!
text: I really enjoyed this new Ghostbusters film! Unlike some people,I actually like this better than Afterlife!! I don't dislike the Spengler family,but Afterlife felt like a really long boring episode of Stranger Things with GB elements. This feels like a real Ghostbusters movie to me,and it's got an entirely brand new villain. It has cheesy elements that reminded me of Answer the Call though. The Indian guy is sort of annoying and felt unnecessary though. Replace him with Dana Barrett or Louis Tully or even Holtzmann coming through to lend a hand on the ghostbusting,and this movie would be perfect. Heck even any of the characters from Filmation Ghostbusters would have been better than that guy. I did like Podcast in this movie more too. Wished it went a little bit longer and Venkman should have had more dialogue,but I felt goosebumps when he and Walter Peck were on the same screen together. Atherton looking a bit like Vincent Price in his old age. Funny there were vape shop reference too as I was vaping the whole time while watching in the theater lol. Slimer was awesum,and also time to bring back Ecto Cooler. If you downvote on this you're just a herp derpin ahole square and I don't care cuz I'm definitely gonna watch this again 2 more times! Oh and Ernie Hudson will be appearing on my radio show soon,really excited about that.

title: A Chilling New Chapter That Captures Hearts and Ghosts Alike
text: "Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire" emerges as a frosty breath of fresh air in the storied Ghostbusters franchise, delivering a spirited blend of humor, heart, and supernatural thrills that honor the legacy of the original films while charting a bold new course into the unknown.As New York City finds itself under the grip of an icy supernatural threat, a new era of Ghostbusters rises to meet the challenge. This film excels in weaving together the familiar and the novel, introducing a cadre of new characters who are as endearing as they are determined. Their dynamic interactions and personal growth are the heart of this story, providing both laughter and depth to the spectral adventure.The visuals are a standout, with the winter setting of New York providing a picturesque yet haunting backdrop for the action. The special effects team has outdone themselves, creating ghostly phenomena that are as beautiful as they are terrifying, making "Frozen Empire" a feast for the eyes.The narrative does a commendable job of balancing reverence for the past with its own distinct identity. It cleverly nods to the franchise's roots through Easter eggs and cameo appearances that will thrill fans, while also introducing a compelling new villain and storyline that explores themes of legacy and camaraderie in fresh and engaging ways.However, the film is not without its faults. At times, the plot feels overcrowded, attempting to juggle too many storylines and character arcs, which can detract from the main narrative thrust. Additionally, while the humor is generally well-pitched, some jokes miss the mark, feeling either forced or out of step with the scene's tone.Nonetheless, "Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire" stands as a laudable addition to the Ghostbusters universe. It successfully captures the essence of what made the original films so beloved, while also daring to venture into new territories. The result is a movie that feels both familiar and innovative, offering a comforting nostalgia trip and an exciting new adventure.In sum, "Frozen Empire" is a must-watch for fans of the franchise and newcomers alike. It proves that there's still plenty of life (and afterlife) left in the Ghostbusters saga, and that sometimes, to find warmth, one must brave the cold.

title: Bustin makes me feel good
text: Listen, i grew up on the old ghostbusters. So of course i was skeptical of this new era. I really enjoyed Afterlife, but thought maybe they got lucky.Frozen empire was awesome. It was action packed, had some eerie vibes to it with ple ty of comic relief. I've really enjoyed the path they have taken with this new era, while still tying a lot of nostolgia to it.Yes, there is a lot of fan service (which i enjoy) but they dont try to make the movie stand on it. A couple thing felt forced but it was still plenty of fun seeing it.My only knock on this movie was it kind of felt like a stand alone. I guess it felt attatched to Afterlife but didnt really seem to further the story, which is common sometimes in second movies.Either way, fun and entertaining movie!

title: Great movie, classic style and fun
text: A cool popcorn movie to have fun. Many references to the original movies, so a lot of fan service. The amount of scenes with the original actors is just awesome, more than in "legacy", I really enjoyed it. The "family part" appeared a little forced and artifical, but it was not too bad. On the other hand there were so many cool scenes and funny details, Slimer is back, too, just great ghostbusters style. We even have several great action scenes with new gear, that are really fun to watch. Regarding story it is nothing too special, but very good entertainment in the classic spirit of the franchise. In my view, actually there are many similarities to Ghostbusters I, if you liked the classic, probably you like that one, too. You know who you gonna call! ;-)

title: Why the hate?
text: We actually LOVED IT!It was hilarious and well done. I'm kind of surprised by the bad reviews, my guess would be they didn't watch the originals?So many little nuggets in there you may not understand if you haven't seen the original. Not the first to this new franchise, I'm talking the OG movies!A lot of laugh out loud parts, it's been awhile since that's happened. Great comedic timing by everyone.The only character that was just "meh" for me was maybe Phoebe's new "friend". I don't know if it was the actress, or the part... but otherwise, I thought it fabulous.It's not often a follow up film is just a good as the first.

title: Ignore the Hate
text: Ignore the hate. It was a fun family movie with lots of recall to the originals. There is comedy, danger, and adventure. The multiple story lines do all come together and form one larger story.Yes, I do wish they would have made more time to introduce the villain and allow for more screen time. I get it though as he was crazy powerful. Some backstory as actual film might have helped, but over all it was so good.My whole family enjoyed the movie. We are hopeful there will be more and we would love to see them all. Take the time and see it to form your own thoughts. Go in ready for some fun, adventure, and great cinematic moments.

title: What Afterlife should have been
text: Ghostbusters: Frozen EmpireGhostbusters: Frozen Empire, sequel to Afterlife, is the Ghostbusters movie that we should have gotten to start with. This is not to say that Afterlife wasn't good. I liked it. But Frozen Empire has so much more going for it.First of all, the Spangler family now live in New York City, in the old firehouse. They are driving (careening) around town taking care of ghosts, just like the original team from 40 years ago. The movie continues the cameos that appeared in Afterlife. I smiled so big when they show the ghosts in the library, like the original film.One of the other improvements was the reduction in Trevor's appearances. He's not quite as stupid as the first movie, but I think the filmmakers didn't know what to do with him, and basically cut him out of most of the film.Having a random "old god that predates known written language" works perfectly in the Ghostbusters world. Go watch the 1984 version again and tell me that it wasn't ridiculous then too. But it's done with so much humor that you can't help but fall under its spell.Regarding the humor, the movie is chock full of it. Afterlife had some, but Frozen Empire brings back the fun and charm of the original movie. Silly puns, dad jokes and some hamming it up worked so well that I want to see this again.One problem I had, though, was the tiny Stay Puff Marshmallow Men. We already have the horrible Minions franchise. We don't need more of that crap. They're never funny; trust me. I truly believe they're only in the movie to try and ride the coattails of the inexplicable continuing popularity of the heroes of the People of Walmart.Go see it. Afterlife is needed to explain the Spangler family, and Paul Rudd, but the movie stands on its own. It's fun.

title: The Ghostbusters legacy continues.
text: GHOSTBUSTERS 4....... That is how I see as I do not count that terrible so called reboot from 2016. Just like AFTERLIFE this movie continues with the legacy and continuity of the 84 and 89 movies as it should, and just like AFTERLIFE it doesnt slap the fans and lore in the face like the 2016 movie did and not only that both AFTERLIFE and FROZEN EMPIRE have not only women in it but also teenage kids, the difference between this and AFTERLIFE compared to the 2016 reboot......THEY ARE BETTER MOVIES THAN THE 2016 VERSION BY MILES.Anyway I finally managed to watch GB4 in the cinema and I am glad I did, much like GB3:AFTERLIFE it brought me back to when I was kid watching the original two movies. Everything was in this movie....the nostalgia, the references, the enjoyment and entertainment that made me want to say........."Busting makes me feel good"This is what I wanted from the franchise for years.....all tho the PS3/PS4 game came very very close to a true Ghostbusters 3 movie and reunion but I have to say I can accept both AFTERLIFE and Frozen Empire as good entries in the franchise, story and continuity to make me happy.Bring on Ghostbusters 5.

title: Fast paced ghost-fun for the entire family
text: This is a perfect movie for the entire family. The kids can relate to the teenage ghostbusters that we met in the last movie, and the parents can equally relate to the problems with hiring your kids for ghosthunting. The movie is fun, exciting and just a little scary even for older kids. It has the almost perfect blend of nostalgia for adults that grew up with the OG movies and fresh content for newer fans.The only criticism I have is that some of the character development happens a bit too quick. The pivotal relationship between the protagonist and the "blue girl" happens to fast and we do not really understand why they "click". On the other hand, the movie is already almost two hours long so it's perfectly understandable why they chose to go that way.

title: A Great watch
text: I honestly had a lot of fun with this one. I know a lot of people didn't like this one, and I honestly don't get it.The cast (Old, Nostalgic, and New), were all great in there roles. Paul Rudd is still a National Treasure, Bill Murray, Dan Aykroyd, and Ernie Hudson were amazing, and they were able to get the serious and silly moments down great.The build up for the main villain was great. A great build up with the opening, the constant teases, and many more. They really make him feel like he'll end the world in a snap like that. He honestly make the other two villains feel like pawns. The visuals were also great (especially the main villain).It surprisingly has a pretty good emotional anchor to put it together, and I really enjoy the arcs Phoebe goes through. That one ghost also gives me some questions that I do hope gets explored.Honestly, the best I can say this one is that it felt like an episode of the old cartoon and if so, and amazing one. It's great at feeling like another adventure with these characters, while giving you enough to care what's going on.However, there are two complaints. One, I thought that the whole "Fire-master angle", where they straight up have fire bending, is really dumb. I can generally believe in the things they throw me, but the whole fire bending angle they had with this one character was dumb (still liked the character itself).Two, I feel like it just ended way too soon. Once we got Garaka out, the film shifted into maximum overdrive. However, when you think it's reaching the height of the battle, it's just over. I felt like they should've had a bit more time to give us with the main villain, especially with how great his build up was.But overall, I really enjoyed the film. It had fun characters, good drama, decent jokes, and good build up and stakes, but kind of just ended after a bit. I can't wait to see more of the Spengler Family soon honestly.

title: "Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire" is a quite entertaining film and superior to its predecessor in many ways.
text: "Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire" is a film that manages to be better than its predecessor. The script is entertaining and tells a story with an eighties feel in 2024. The New York atmosphere plays an important role and makes the film's visuals incredible. The cinematography is quite accurate, the director's work is of a good level and the cast gives good performances, both the actors from the original film and those presented in the predecessor achieve be nice in every scene. The special effects also improved compared to the last film, this time they look much more real. "Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire" is a quite entertaining film and superior to its predecessor in many ways.

title: Bustin Makes Me Feel Good
text: I went into this movie expecting that I was going to be disappointed. The title and premise seemed like a stretch and the early reviews were not good. I could not have been more wrong. This movie was pretty damn good. Not perfect but I laughed out loud enough times that my wife was eyeballing me like knocking off. You're embarrassing me hahaha. Also, it does not fall into the trap of so many. The remakes and sequels where they lean super heavy on the nostalgia button. Don't get me wrong. It's great to see the old cast but It doesn't feel like a movie you've seen before at all. Definitely go see it!

title: Great film with lots of fun
text: The new Ghostbusters film is a delightful homage to the classics, cleverly blending humor and nostalgia for fans who grew up with the originals. It combines a compelling story with nods to 80s-style filmmaking, creating a joyful blend of humor and action that honors the legacy. The return of the old cast alongside the new provides a charming mix, making this movie feel like a heartfelt tribute to the originals while adding fresh twists. Despite receiving mixed reviews, this film is crafted for those who love the classics. It's packed with jokes, thrilling moments, and all the fun you'd expect. Watch it, enjoy it, and don't be too critical! It's not worse than any Marvel movie and perfectly captures the spirit of the series. I'm excited to see what's in store for the next installment!

title: Seen.
text: This movie was a complete let down it had so much potential and it was super slow and it didnt really make sense. The moral didnt make sense and the very end just felt like just too easy if that makes sense. And they also wasted good lore for a dumb joke that could have been a good character development point. I think the last ghostbuster was way better than this one but the very first ghostbuster is definitely the goat of ghostbusters. Lacking in plot, but spiced with enjoyable humour and performances, Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire supplies a slightly bland yet satisfying sequel to a slowly dying franchise. Filled with nostalgic references, Frozen Empire passes the time, with some laughs here and there.

title: Fantastic - with a few editing requirements
text: To make this movie watchable I have a few important editing requirements: 1) completely remove ALL scenes with the burning blue girl ghost, including the final match lighting scene, nobody will notice it's missing 2) completely remove ALL scenes where Paul Rudd (the father figure), Carrie Coon (the mother figure) or William Atherton (the mayor) are talking. All their speaking parts and verbal interactions with other characters need to be removed.And VOILA! After the successful removal of those cringe moral scenes, which in itself are the horror part of this movie, we have ourselves 45 minutes of teenager & grandfathers ghost chasing fun, with a couple of funny sketches!

title: Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire
text: When I seen this was finished and in theaters I could not help myself. I had to go to theaters and see it. I enjoyed it, as I have all the Ghostbusters films. I was very excited to see the original crew from the 80s was brought back so they too could participate in this great story that is being kept alive. The story brings new characters and a new plot, in spite of the old ones still being on the scene. Ray, Venkman, and Ernie Hudsons character are all here. Some of the characters more successful in life then others. The new story is centered around a per evil demon that is determined to take over the earth by freezing it! Crazy stuff but very fun!

title: If you're expecting nostalgia, don't watch this.
text: But if you're expecting a good continuation of the story, then definitely do.This move, to me showed an evolution to the franchise. Ghostbusters 2016, which felt like a bastardization. Afterlife, felt like a giant nostalgia boner.While I appreciate the fact they wanted to honor Harold Ramis, I don't think he would appreciate a movie that was made just to recreate the original movie with new characters.And I felt that resonated in this movie. It's clear that it was well thought out this time, planned, and looked at all of the franchise at a whole, and asked the question, "How can we move forward in this franchise".Putting it back in NYC for me, gave me a different kind of nostalgia boner than afterlife. But let me just compare afterlife with another piece of media that some might know - parasite eve. I felt they made the same mistake as that game. They took a story outside of it's environment, and it felt odd for doing so. Whenever a media goes from 'city' to suddenly 'dessert', it's a hard and dis-jarring contrast in environment, which usually ruins it. (Also - turtles in time)Anyways, I think, while starting to feel like a generic Marvel movie, this movie did very well at evolving. It brought ghost busters to the modern era, and made it very relatable to today's standards. I definitely can't hate this movie. But it does loose points and charm for being kind of a generic action movie.Now, unpopular opinion, but I think overall this movie did amazing in telling a intellectually stimulating story. While far-fetched, I was extremely surprised at the pseudo science and metaphysics delivered. It established clear rules about how things worked, and what the theory behind it was (Dan Aykroyd was this your doing?) lol.But speaking of the guy - damn. His role as a guide and tutor in this movie, rivaled the role of Rocky in the Creed series of movies. He even goes as far as to make personal jabs at himself and how the public perceived him for some of the things he believed.
