But hey, who else can bring the right amount of explanation to all of this, that the movie needed.It honestly felt like the true continuation the movies needed, and I hope to see more from the franchise, as this movie lays the foundation for newer movies to come.

title: Ghostbusters, what'd ya want?!
text: I loved this movie! These last two GB movies have been fantastic. I definitely want to see more Ghostbusting from the Spenglers and their extended family. These last two entries captured the spirit of the 1984 Ghostbusters perfectly. The critic consensus says something about uneven tones. The modern critics generic go to in my opinion, lazy critique. Contemporary critics don't always get it right, just go read the Blade Runner reviews in 1981 as an example. They are entitled to their opinion just like anyone else. And no one is wrong for liking or disliking a movie. But if they didn't like the tone here, that means they didn't like the tone of the Original GB, either. The tone here, was right on. There are some messy things in the plot but it's so much fun, those are easily overlooked. Just like in 1984, a lot of laughs and a few scares. Keep it going Jason and Gil. Keep on trucking.

title: Ignore the bad reviews this was an excellent adventure!
text: It was always going to be dancing between a rock and a hard place trying to please everyone with another Ghostbuster movie. You have to modernise the franchise for it to survive and I think they have done a great job of doing that while looking after us older fans who just loved the originals and the whole package so much. Yes, I see how doing so will lose some older fans who don't buy into the the aspects put there for the younger quirkier Stranger Things type followers, it probably won't appeal to a sourdough eating audience who have low tolerance for cheese and nostalgia either but I think it will make hopefully the majority of the masses happy and true lovers of the franchise leaving the cinema feeling young again and grateful that they are back and it didn't suck at all. Not sure how many more movies there will be as to me, it was clear that you simply can not replace the older original cast when it comes to serious Ghostbusting.

title: Worthy of it Predecessors
text: I really enjoyed this movie.I really wanted to see this movie in the Cinema but after it came out I saw some negative reviews . I really enjoyed Ghostbusters, Ghostbusters II and Ghostbusters Afterlife - I even enjoyed the somewhat lambasted Ghostbusters 2016!Frozen Empire has everything you could want as a fan. The new Afterlife characters are back and some old favourites have joined them.This is an original story that is really compelling and has a lot of actions and laughsThe best thing about this movie is that it has all the things you want from a Ghostbusters movie without being a carbon copy of the original Ghostbusters.

title: Blockbuster of the year!
text: One of the best comedy movies I've seen in a long. Here's why.This film has made the list to be considered a household classic! My first hand of applause I'd like to give, is for the folks responsible for picking out the actors. The beautiful variety of men and women who contributed to delivering a fruitful experience is top-notch. Adding Bill Murray is a triumph of its own. As for the crisp-tasting touch of comedy, Kumail Nanjiani was an outstanding choice for his role. As for the folks writing the story. Well done. Everything fit just perfectly. Cinderella would be proud. The jokes were exactly what the audience yearned for. I can't express how delighted I was by them. They were so organic just one after the other. I wanted seconds! The ending was just so heartfelt when she called him that. This is the exact type of drop-dead gorgeous film I would recommend to anyone. Not only was I entertained but I felt so alive. This is, the family film of the year! Absolutely no doubt about it. I wish the dead could see it! On behalf of the world, I genuinely would love to thank every single person who was a part of this masterpiece. Remarkable work everyone!!! Because of this motion picture, I have undeniable faith in the movie industry. Looking forward to the next one!

title: I want more VILLAINS like the cartoons These villains are still not compelling enough
text: This franchise needs to take more chances with the material from the cartoons. Villains like SAM HEIN, WHAT, KILLERWATT, and the SANDMAN are all amazing story characters you could make a few amazing movies from. KILLERWATT was a class 9 phantasm that could control large pieces of MATTER so imagine the kind of villain you could make from this ;) SAM HEIN was a badass , SCARY villain that would make a great Halloween movie. Jason is bringing some good writing and technology LORE to the franchise and this villain was still cool. Im just ready to see them follow more of what made the cartoon an iconic platform of storytelling. Well done nonetheless guys! :)

title: What do people actually want?
text: I really don't get the hate for this film reading the reviews. I'm a massive fan of the original Ghostbusters and enjoyed Afterlife as it was in keeping with the original films. This film carries on the franchise, retaining the originals and allowing the new cast to thrive. I'm not sure what people were talking about regarding character development. The story revolves around Phoebe and the character development is there. I also think Paul Rudd fits Ghostbusters perfectly. Dan Ackroyd / Ray was amazing as ever and Winston and Venkman make appearances for good measure. This is the first time I have ever gone to the cinema alone as I wanted to see this film. It was in true SPIRIT of the Ghostbusters. People should stop moaning and enjoy a good film. Bring on the next film!

title: Huge Ghostbusters Fan
text: I'm a huge ghostbusters fan, to the point where the last movie made me cry, the nostalgia how genuinely brilliant the film was, this however although I don't dislike it, but I don't love it either.Solid movie but just felt that the story was kind of lacking, I've given it a generous 8 more likely a 6.5 but gave it an 8 as the characters have developed well, it was entertaining and definitely worth seeing (if your a fan of the last one) just felt like it could have been the start of something amazing rather than what could be a stand alone movie.The original characters were brilliant and the surprise of who the Mayor is now was good.Like I say nothing to dislike, just wish it was something I could say I loved!

title: Movie script captured the essence of the (1984) original Ghostbusters film
text: This movie script perfectly captured the essence of the (1984) original Ghostbusters film, pleasing lifelong fans of the franchise. The Spengler family reunites with the original Ghostbusters at the iconic New York City firehouse, Hook & Ladder 8, where the Ghostbuster organization's journey first began. The writers included some old 1984 ghosts in this film as well. I was impressed by how the film crew and editors skillfully included Harold Ramis in the Afterlife (2021) film. The passing of Harold in 2014 left all his fans deeply saddened. Now that we know Dr. Egon Spengler's family has inherited his super-natural-scientific talents, it is game on for the next generation of Ghostbusters. The cameo characters of Bill Murray, Dan Aykroyd, Ernie Hudson, Annie Potts and William Atherton were brilliant. Seeing those characters again in the movie script was extremely satisfying and resonated with me as a member of the Generation X fans. I'm not finding Finn Wolfhard's portrayal of Trevor Spengler convincing in this iteration of Ghostbusters. It's as if his personality took a complete 180 compared to the script of the Afterlife film. In my opinion, Finn portrayed the character with more depth in the Afterlife (2021) edition of Ghostbusters. It could be attributed to his involvement in script writing, but the portrayal of the 18-year-old brother in the Spengler family didn't resonate with me. McKenna Grace, Paul Rudd, and Carrie Coon nailed their parts in the Spengler family business.

title: Good family fun!!
text: Just got back from seeing this and was so put off by the negative reviews but have to say we loved! It was a great family movie I took my 5,7 and 9 year olds who really enjoyed it, sat through with no issues. There were some genuine really funny moments in it, Paul Rudd was great as always. There was only one moment my 7 year old climbed on my knee as he was scared but other than that it really was fine for kids and very easy to follow. The only thing I'll agree with is the cast was a little crowded but that's no reason not to watch and enjoy. I also loved the nostalgia and the fact the originals were included just the right amount. I think if you're on the fence and are a ghostbusters fan or just looking for a fun family movie it really is worth watching!

title: Exactly what I expected and I loved it.
text: These days people seem to go to a movie like this, expecting a Cinematic masterpiece. Then they come here and give a bad rating and comments like... It was boring or it was predictable or the writing was bad or I didn't like the actors or the original actors are just dialing it in. I enjoyed this movie and it was everything I expected. Suspend disbelief, chill out and enjoy. It's supposed to be funny and silly nonsense.In my humble opinion, it was great to see Dan Aykroyd, Bill Murray, and the other original actors back. I think the new actors are a great addition and fit right in. If you wanna be all serious and expect perfection go watch a classic.

title: Excellent but had a few flaws...
text: The movie in itself is really good. Great cast, great story, great acting, great effects, and great comedy. However, I personally think the main story was written wrong. You spend 80% of the movie building up this awesome epic plot and then when the final protagonist actually comes, it's only there for about 20 min and then boom that's the end. Again, very well done, very well written, and I love all the little unspoken story plot devices, but overall, a bit disappointing. I loved the series and this movie and it's one that I might even watch it again. Hopefully the continue the series and the next one is even better.

title: Really a Great edition, keep it up!
text: Look let me go over the negatives people mention:1. Not much Screen Time for main ghost? If I recall Gozar only got under 10 minutes in the original. Both good movies.2. Not much storyline closure. I sorta agree, but this wasn't as big an issue for me. I felt like the movie went all over the place following 3 or 4 areas rather than having it be all about the maun characters. Well I don't have much love yet for the new crew so it didn't bother me as much, but it would have been nice to see Dan mentor them more to do a better transition to them in the future.I really enjoyed it, and had alot of fun seeing the shots toward the old movies, and its awesome to see the old gang still involved. Overall its still my 4th fav of the series, but its a great series so i won't complain. I do hope to see more, and I'd love to see the main cast get more time and keep the focus on the main storyline more.I'd give it a 7 if i felt people weren't just complaining for the sake of it. Its an above average movie, but not perfect.

title: Great Family Bonding
text: Ghostbusters (1984) was my favorite movie when I was a kid. I remember wearing out the VHS tapes and playing with the action figures along with the movie.Now that I am a father of two girls, I jumped at the chance with Frozen Empire to create a Daddy-Daughter bonding moment with my oldest. I loved the movie and the throwback references to the first two films and the appearances by the originals. My daughter loved Phoebe (which is awesome for her to see a strong and smart girl as the lead) and of course Slimer and mini Stay-Pufts.Awesome nostalgia and bonding moment for me and I can't wait to have Ghostbuster family costumes for Halloween. I highly recommend any fan of Ghostbusters (1984) with daughters to see the movie.

title: Excellent movie, keep with this kind of films please.
text: I think the movie was pretty decent for a sequel, I love Ghostbusters and the fact that they continue making this type of movies makes me nostalgic, continue with a sequel. I hope that in the future they structure this universe so well so that they can create something like the Godzilla monsterverse or the Marvel cinematic universe. The young actors are promising and putting them together with the older generation makes the film even more fantastic. I think this is the type of film that one enjoys watching as a family since it brings back memories for the parents and creates new memories for their children.

title: It's a fun film and scratches the nostalgia itch.
text: I pretty much loved it, is it perfect? No... but honestly it's a fun film, it's not going to ever capture the 80's movies essence, and that's because it's not the 80's anymore. That being said, it's fun, heartwarming and is pretty much non stop from the get go, if anything I'd critique the runtime, a little longer movie would have allowed them to flesh out a few parts here and there, because at times it does feel as though the pacing is slightly too fast. I'm not an huge fan of having kids as ghostbusters, however they do a decent job, I'm just old and miss the OG busters. Overall a good, fun, family movie.

title: Well worth a watch
text: In an age where special effects and 'A listers' come before a decent plot this made for a refreshing change. Bustling with unforced energy from start to finish it's stands alone as a solid fantasy film even whilst standing within that hefty Ghostbusters shadow. The cast is great, with the Spengler family continuing to make these new films their own along with the surprising yet excellent addition of James Acaster as a new "Q" styled member of the team. Dan Akroyd beautifully ties in the nostalgia while helping to hand over the baton. With nods to the original(s) handled very well. Expect a few laughs along the way in what is an excellent story. If, like me, you were a kid growing up in the 80's then this is right up your street.

title: Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire
text: Mckenna Grace is amazing, very sweet pretty and young, and she look like my sister from other mother, the stories this like prevous and prevous before them is superb in sound, picrure and humor sence. Cheers for about the movies that love gets us into and a film about the story of love under siege. Unpredictable and crazy is he, this gives us a unique opportunity, after seeing the film, to take part in the events yourself until the end, any way I feel you're great, can give us a chance crossroads, viewed from high enough, looks like a crucifix. title: Another triumphant sequel for the Ghostbusters
text: Once again, the critics were wrong about the Ghostbusters just like they were when Afterlife came out. This was definitely another triumphant sequel for the Ghostbusters. Plenty of humor, excitement, thrills, chills, action and spooky eerie ghosts for the Ghostbusters to catch, including the evil ghostly god Garraka. He was probably the biggest bad the Ghostbusters had ever faced and just as big and bad as Gozer the Gozerian. Also, McKenna Grace delivers another fantastic performance as Phoebe Spengler in this movie. Also, there is betrayal in this movie, but I shouldn't give out any spoilers for this part of the movie. Ten out of ten for this.

title: Fixed Most of the Problems i had with the Awful AFTERLIFE. A Fantastic Superior Sequel.
text:
First off I'm a Ghostbusters fan, I'm one of the originals from that era as i was born in 1984 (when Ghostbusters First came out) & the first movie i ever saw at the Cinema was Ghostbusters 2 in 1989 when i was 5 years old & that Cinema experience stayed with me all my life. I have major history with Ghostbusters, i also grew up watching the Real Ghostbusters animated series & then the excellent underrated Extreme Ghostbusters in the 90's. I had Ghostbusters 1&2 on video & growing up & watched them constantly i also had all the Real Ghostbusters toys. I'm a real proper Ghostbusters fan who literally grew up with the Ghostbusters.Silly unpopular opinion is i absolutely loved the female lead 2016 Ghostbusters.I saw the ladies Ghostbusters at the cinema with my wife & daughter & we loved it. The 2016 movie is a fantastic 8/10 in my opinion & that Ghostbusters I'm proud to say is my daughters Ghostbusters, a Ghostbusters for them & it was GREAT. The ladies were fantastic together & so funny. The gadgets & new proton packs were better than the originals in my opinion. Also the 2016 Ghostbusters remains the actually funniest of the whole franchise!!! Also the old 1970's Times Square big battle final action sequence is probably the best Ghostbusters action scene of the franchise. There's so much great stuff in the ladies version & the only reason it was hated was because of Misogynistic idiots. But hey i felt the 2016 Ghostbusters fingerprints on Frozen Empire like Ganine Melnitz small hand proton blaster is practically the same as used in the Ladies version!!!Another unpopular opinion from me is i couldn't stand GHOSTBUSTERS: AFTERLIFE!!! I had huge problems with it as it was like an indie film mixed with a kids Nickelodeon version of Ghostbusters. Also the awful Afterlife ruined the main characters. The fact the Ghostbusters fell apart because Egon (Harold Ramis) believed a new supernatural Apocalypse with Gozer returning was NOT believed by his buddies & other Ghostbusters is ridiculous!!! The fact that Egon stole Ghostbusters equipment & done a runner to live in a small desolate town is ridiculous. Why would the Ghostbusters, that have Been through Gozer & Vigo & the River of slime & Mr. Staypuft Marshmallow man & everything else would suddenly not believe in Egon Spengler is insulting to the characters & the fans. Also Afterlife ignored the fact Ghostbusters 2 even happened? Thankfully the Awesome FROZEN EMPIRE fixed most of these problems.Anyway Afterlife was garbage in my opinion.Ghostbusters: FROZEN EMPIRE was a real blast of creativity with the franchise, we had strong Nostalgia & our old team that are like old friends by now were given bigger roles, especially Dan Aykroyd as Ray Stantz (my all-time favorite Ghostbuster) he was a the heart of this superior sequel. I pretended that Afterlife didn't exist & this movie was simply the old Ghostbusters that have recruited a new younger team like the 90's Extreme Ghostbusters. Afterlife doesn't exist.We're back in New York City where the Ghostbusters should be for FROZEN EMPIRE. This is a big fun popcorn blockbuster & for that it's on point.Major shout out for letting us know that GHOSTBUSTERS 2 (my fave) did happen & is definitely Cannon (the awful Afterlife ignored it) by a news report at the beginning of this superior sequel that shows the Statue of Liberty walking!!! I had a huge smile. Still there's stuff that's not great like how they never seem to really give us character depth, we never know if the old gang have families or have wives or husbands or kids???? Do they all live near each other? Do they meet up regularly? No real insight at all with our beloved characters but to be honest even the old films never dug into the characters at all.Paul Rudd was awesome & really is a perfect choice to be a new GHOSTBUSTER.The kids/teens were really great & are very gifted actors & very likeable.In fact the whole cast was great in their roles. It was nice seeing Walter Peck back again, this time as the Mayor of New York & still with a bone-to-pick with the Ghostbusters. Thank you William Atherton for returning for his iconic character, a good sport.There's new faces that are all fun & likable in parts. The humour is actually funny but it's not over silly & the spooky factor is done in the style of Ghostbusters 1&2.We have a new demonic spirit that is Unleashed from an ancient artifact that ends up in Ray's supernatural store. The creature is eventually Unleashed & New York City is frozen over & evil spirit are on the rampage. I loved the creepy look of Garakka the Ice Demon that has a nice backstory & mythology. I felt this Ghostbusters dug into rich old mythology & ancient cursed & possessed artifacts. Ghostbusters could go the Conjuring universe way if it wanted with each cursed artifact getting a spooky movie about it. The drath chill created by the evil Garraka is done fantastically with super special fx that turns a hot & sweaty New York summer into a new ice age. This new villain is fantastically scary & taken seriously. I got vibes of the Real Ghostbusters cartoon which was obviously an inspiration for this movie. Also a nice use of the original '84 music score scattered throughout the movie, a nice Nostalgic touch.I loved how the movie went into proper horror territory towards the end that made film actually feel threatening.There's amazing special effects throughout & lots of awesome ghosts & new fun technology & traps.Ernie Hudson is great in a bigger role (finally) as Winston Zeddemore.I was nice seeing Annie Potts as Ganine Melnitz back in action & as a Ghostbuster, i love her character.It was actually Bill Murray as Venkman that had the smallest part but was nice when he's there. The old team are great on screen.There's some very nice little touching moments sprinkled throughout like when Ray & Winston are talking about how old they are & how these are their golden years.Also nice little cameos from classic ghosts like the Library Ghost & Slimer, both done beautifully. So glad Dan Aykroyd had a main part back as Ray Stantz, he's older as they all are but still has that big excited heart for all things supernatural.There's a nice sweet warm touch of Nostalgia sprinkled throughout the movie that makes you smile.FROZEN EMPIRE has heart & Nostalgia for us old school fans who grew up loving these movies & characters.Ghostbusters were a huge part of our childhoods.Gil Kenan was a great choice of director & I'm a fsn of his excellent animated horror fantasy comedy MONSTER HOUSE, it's a Halloween staple in my house. Also he did a decent & fun remake of POLTERGEIST, the guy is great at family friendly scares.All in all i had a blast watching this new Ghostbusters movie, fun & full of heart.FOR IVAN (Just beautiful)
My Ratings of the franchise:
Ghostbusters (1984) 10/10
Ghostbusters 2 (1989) 10/10
Ghostbusters: Answer The Call (2016) 8/10
Ghostbusters: Afterlife (2021) 2/10
Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire (2024) 8/10.

title: Good film
text: Ok, just going to say this... ignore all the haters on here and their over critical reviews. Most of them don't have a life and probably sit around all day doing nothing but watching movies. Now down to the film. It was a good watch. Just go and remeber it is supposed to be a fun film. Yes, more scary compared to the other three films, but definitely deserves to accepted into the franchise. It was way better than Ghostbusters 2. Now that film was a bot of a cluster but still a fun one. I feel movie watchers today are so over critical and thinned skinned. We are a generation of over complainers. Now go enjoy the film with an open fun mind.

title: The best since part 2
text: Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire felt a lot like the original, while not relying on the original to weave a fun ghost busting story. I say weave because there's a lot going on. Many characters all with their own character arcs are cleverly edited together in a story that is blended into the drive of the film, which is its characters. While you could just make it full of ghost action, we get treated to some interesting character dilemmas with some smart comedy sprinkled throughout.Nostalgia. Memberberries. Fan service. While not negative for a lot (most) people, many others view these things as detriments to a movie. To me, they are a part of a franchise's identity, as long as they aren't used to fill empty space. Frozen Empire never got stagnated by nostalgia, nor did anything ever outlast itself. Funny lines came quick and were never dwelled upon. Action that could've padded the run time was cut short in favor of story. It handled its complex plot, but simple story very well by focusing on its characters and their situations rather than unnecessary action to fill the run time. Yes, there's a lot of characters, and some have little screen time, but they were all utilized exactly how they should have been, even if they all didn't contribute as much as the main characters. It's these side characters to help expand the layers of subplots that come together in the end.My fear for the movie was how it would handle the fact that there's several kids who are taking part in action and science of ghost busting. It needed to be addressed, and the movie did this head on. Everything that played out made sense in the real world. I was astonished that the filmmakers didn't gloss over the idea that some kids would be involved in saving the city from a horned demon ghost. In the end, not only will families enjoy the fun nature of the movie, it passes on a technical level as a bonus that turns it from something that could've been okay, to a surprise film that I had a lot of fun with.

title: classic storytelling
text: This movie has a coming of age feel. Stong family values. Movie also explores parent and child relationships as well as friendships, family legacy, leaving behind a legacy as you get older , identity and individualism vs community/family. Empire reminds me of 80s and 90s movies. For a deeper look at these themes see Popcorn Theologys review of the film. Movie did not have as many funny jokes as Afterlife or the 84 movies, in my opinion . Acting was good. Action was good. Practical effects were awesome! See Adam Savages videos. Some takeaways: take advice from people who know and care about you. Don't write off your family. Don't communicate with occult.

title: "Proud of you then, proud of you now"
text: The several I see that say it's better than Afterlife don't make sense they should rate higher than a 7 I rated Afterlife at least a 9, this one had some meh moments but overall spectacular experience! I saw in RPX which was lucky cause not much of those left. This was a lot of fun, plenty of funny moments, amazing music, great story, awesome vibes, and nice to see the original cast doing well! I had quite an adventure yesterday by biking to the movies quite worth it except struggled to sleep last night. Frozen Empire was fantastic all around and I'm one of few that loves Ghostbusters II not much appreciate that one. I don't think this was better than the previous one I'd still give an 8.

title: A lot of fun and reignites old school feel
text: This movie was FUN - It had likable characters, fan service, good plot, lot of action, didn't rush plot elements, good buildup and climax and most of all - It feels like you're watching an expansive of the much loved Ghostbusters we grew up with.Let's face it - There are a lot of BAD reboots nowadays. Ghostbusters Afterlife was a great breath of fresh air and while this isn't "as good" - from the opening scene you get the feeling you're back in the good old 90s with how it's paced, how the characters act with minimal fillers and everything expanding an established universe in a fun way.I really liked the extra elements they added and how they tied little things together.If you remember how to have fun and enjoy the movie for what it is being a Ghostbusters fan AND/OR just enjoying a movie that doesn't try to be overly fancy and add a bunch of filler material and stays true to what it's designed for, they you will enjoy this movie as much as I did.

title: 9/10, really enjoyed it
text:
Not a perfect movie and if you want to nitpick it then go ahead but it's such a fun movie to sit down and watch for a while, good ghost content, funny comedy, fair amount of action and whilst it wasn't as good as Afterlife it was still such a fun ridePros -
Very fun, good comedy, a lot darker than previous ghostbusters movies, has some fun action sequences and just overall was very enjoyable, gets better as you go along, so fun to have the original ghostbusters in it as wellCons -
Not enough screen time for Podcast and not enough time to fully have fun with James Acaster9/10, Fairly fun movie.

title: Still better than the reboot
text: You know what I hate? When movie trailers outright lie to the audience about what they can expect from the movie. Take Ghostbusters Frozen Empire for example. If you were to watch the trailers for this film, you would assume the whole film would feature the city of New York being frozen over, especially given the title. However, upon actually watching the film, it becomes all too clear that part doesn't happen until the last 30 minutes. I get it: you want to focus on showcasing the fun parts. But, couldn't you find a way to do it without deceiving your viewers? Now, all this is more of a criticism of the marketing than the movie itself which, all things considered, is a lot of fun. I thought going in that the story would be really predictable, but none of the plot points went in the directions I expected and there were some genuinely good twists. The humor was on point as usual, with plenty of good lines, amusing gags, and some cool cameos. There do seem to be a few scenes missing, as characters sometimes appear in places without explanation, but that only happens a couple of times.I didn't really care for the family drama surrounding Phoebe and her mom. It wasn't terrible, it was just every annoying cliche you'd expect, which really doesn't fly in this series. With that said, they're both still really likeable, and some of the best scenes involve Phoebe and a teen ghost she befriends. The conversations they have are both funny and at times thought provoking. Paul Rudd, the brother, and the geeky friend are enjoyable as always. There's a new protagonist who's a little bland, but gets some decent laughs. The new villain is really intimidating in his brief screentime. The OG Ghostbusters get a lot more screentime, except Venkman, but he still makes the most of his brief appearance. Even Walter Peck returns and I won't lie, as much as I detest this guy, it was actually kind of nice to see him again.The effects are thankfully consistently good. I don't remember how well they stack up against Afterlife, but they certainly look a lot better than the reboot. The scenes where the city gets frozen over look cool (no pun intended) and lead to some genuinely scary moments. The new gadgets presented look great and are showcased well. The action scenes are a ton of fun as always. And hearing the Ghostbusters theme in Dolby Digital was beyond awesome.Overall, Ghostbusters Frozen Empire isn't as good as the OG film, and I don't remember if it's better than Afterlife. But, it's better than Ghostbusters 2 and especially the reboot. And, as my first Ghostbusters film in theaters (I wasn't born yet when the first two came out and I didn't see the reboot or Afterlife), it's a nice bit of nostalgia.

title: Made me more interested in ghostbusters
text: Don't judge me for this but I didn't grow up watching ghostbusters, but when I finished watching this movie in theater, I woke up the next day and watched Ghostbusters: Afterlife. And now I'm encouraged to literally watch every ghostbusters movie to exist. I think this shows that sequels may be bad at times but if they turn out good they can bring new people into their community. Also I might be being a bit biased because I like McKenna Grace- but just ignore that. I don't know if I have any place to actually recommend this movie since I'm not an original fan but please give it a chance. Loved it!

title: Fun movie
text: Everyone did great acting at their roles. It was fun to watch. Parts slowed flow but made up for it. Wanted more ghostbusting. Loved the equipment/gear/ universe building. Winston was awesome. Ray was as well. Of course Dr. Venkman too. Loved the honoring of the fans!Phoebe did great as a character. Her interaction with the one ghost was awkward at times but tricked me on where it was going.Loved the possessor. Slimmer was great to see. I hope they do another to improve. I have mixed feeling's about it but want to love it. It's worth watching again and buying physical copy. And I want them to have another chance on another one. I of course want more with original cast as well.A lot of characters. But I wanted it to work. I like all the characters.That's my opinion at least.

title: It's not THAT bad (No Spoilers)
text: First, I want to get something straight: This movie is not that bad! Out of the many reviews Ive read, it's really just trying to figure out things that have gone wrong with Frozen Empire. And I can agree that there were goofs in the movie, but they weren't so bad! The special effects look great, and there are comedic moments, but not many lines people will be saying years from now. D*ckless returns for another insult, which I liked. The only thing that I didnt like was that there was less of Venkman (Bill Murray). We need more Venkman-One-Liners!Overall, the movie is good, filled with laughs and clear references to the Ghostbusters franchise. Im a huge Ghostbusters fan, and I loved that they got the old crew and old ghosts back.

title: Its a simple fun time movie for the familly
text: From the get go i will be honest. The original Ghostbusters ain't one of my favorite movies of all time. I do like it but im not super huge into it like some other peoples who think its one of the best comedies of all time. Its probably because as a kid, Gozer scared the crap out of me with the red eyes so i didn't watched it again til a long while. I just remembered loving the Stay Puff guy at the end.Anyway, so overall i don't have the same nostalgia some peoples may have for this franchise. When Afterlife came out, i enjoyed it, but i do recall thinking it took a bit its time. Obviously introducing new characters and being set so many years after, its to be expected, but if i could sum it up, i liked it but that was it. Saw it once.Now finally getting to this one, the best way i would describe it is a perfect by the book familly movie. You can bring your kids, you should enjoy it as an adult. Its not perfect, its not a movie ill watch super often, but i enjoyed my time watching it in the theatre. The actors all do a fine job, the character of Pheobie especially being the center stage. Paul Rudd is charming as always.Of course if you start nitpicking on it, you will surely find plenty of issues. I don't think its the right way to approach it. I enjoyed they tried to do something new this time, and the OG cast have more screentime. Yes Murray is once again more on the cameo side, but the rest had decent screentime and presence.For this one i would give a 7.7 out of 10 so im definately bumping it to 8.

title: Outstanding
text: "Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire" is an exhilarating revival of the beloved supernatural comedy franchise that successfully captures the essence of the original films while introducing a fresh, contemporary twist. This movie isn't just a nostalgic trip down memory lane; it's a fully-fledged, stand-alone spectacle that manages to stand on the shoulders of its predecessors to reach new heights.The premise of an icy supernatural threat is a stroke of genius. It allows the film to explore uncharted territory within the Ghostbusters universe, introducing a new pantheon of frost-bound specters that are both visually breathtaking and genuinely menacing. The special effects team deserves immense praise for the creation of the Frozen Empire; the ghosts are an ethereal blend of horror and beauty, with the ice-themed visuals providing a stunning contrast to the proton pack's warm glow.What truly sets this film apart is its ability to balance the scales between the comedic elements that are trademark to the series and a genuinely compelling story. The script is sharp, filled with witty one-liners and clever callbacks that will have the die-hard fans chuckling in their seats. Yet, it never relies solely on past glory to impress. Instead, it carves out its own identity with a storyline that is engaging from start to finish.The new cast members are a revelation, bringing a vibrant energy that complements the return of the original characters. Their performances are heartfelt, and their chemistry is palpable, bringing a sense of camaraderie that harkens back to the first time audiences witnessed the original team strap on their proton packs. The passing of the torch between the old guard and the new is handled with respect and finesse, offering a seamless transition that feels both earned and necessary.Furthermore, the movie does an excellent job of weaving in themes of legacy, teamwork, and the importance of facing one's fears, making "Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire" not just a fun ride but also a film with depth and heart. It strikes the perfect balance between paying respect to the franchise's roots and forging a new path, ensuring that it can be enjoyed by fans old and new alike.Directorially, the film is a triumph. The pacing is impeccable, ensuring that the audience is never left feeling cold despite the wintry setting. Action sequences are expertly choreographed, providing a sense of danger and excitement without ever feeling overblown or losing the human element that anchors the story.In conclusion, "Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire" is a welcome addition to the Ghostbusters legacy. It's a film that manages to be both respectful of its source material and boldly innovative. With a perfect blend of humor, heart, and horror, it's a movie that will undoubtedly leave audiences feeling warm on the inside, despite its chilly exterior. It's a refreshing, spirited adventure that brilliantly captures the essence of what made the original so beloved, while also setting a new benchmark for how to revive classic franchises. A must-see for fans and a delightful discovery for newcomers, "Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire" is a resounding success.

title: Great sequel
text: "Ghostbuster Frozen Empire" is a thrilling sequel that successfully builds upon the legacy of the original movies while introducing new elements that keep audiences engaged and entertained. From its engaging storyline to its well-developed characters and impressive special effects, this film delivers on all fronts, making it a must-see for fans of the franchise and newcomers alike.One of the most impressive aspects of "Ghostbuster Frozen Empire" is its ability to capture the spirit of the original films while also bringing something fresh to the table. The story picks up years after the events of the previous movies, with a new generation of Ghostbusters taking center stage. However, instead of simply retreading familiar ground, the filmmakers have crafted a unique and compelling narrative that expands upon the mythology of the Ghostbusters universe.The film's plot is full of twists and turns, keeping viewers on the edge of their seats from start to finish. From the discovery of a mysterious artifact to the emergence of a powerful new villain, there is never a dull moment in "Ghostbuster Frozen Empire." The pacing is expertly handled, allowing for moments of tension and excitement to build organically while also giving the characters room to breathe and develop.Speaking of characters, "Ghostbuster Frozen Empire" features a diverse and memorable cast of heroes and villains. The new generation of Ghostbusters is led by charismatic and relatable protagonists who are easy to root for. Each character brings something unique to the team, whether it's their technical expertise, quick wit, or fearless determination. And of course, it wouldn't be a Ghostbusters movie without some iconic cameos from familiar faces, adding an extra layer of nostalgia for longtime fans.One of the standout elements of "Ghostbuster Frozen Empire" is its stunning visual effects. From the ghostly apparitions to the epic action sequences, every frame of the film is filled with eye-popping visuals that are sure to leave audiences in awe. The filmmakers have spared no expense in bringing the world of Ghostbusters to life, and the result is a cinematic experience that is truly breathtaking.In addition to its impressive visuals, "Ghostbuster Frozen Empire" also excels in its use of sound design and music. The iconic Ghostbusters theme is given a modern twist, while new tracks help to set the mood and enhance the overall atmosphere of the film. Whether it's the eerie sound of a ghostly whisper or the pulse-pounding beat of an action-packed chase scene, every sound in the film feels purposeful and carefully crafted.Overall, "Ghostbuster Frozen Empire" is a worthy successor to the original movies, capturing the essence of what made them great while also bringing something new to the table. With its engaging storyline, well-developed characters, and stunning visual effects, this film is sure to delight audiences of all ages. Whether you're a die-hard fan of the franchise or simply looking for a fun and entertaining movie to watch, "Ghostbuster Frozen Empire" is not to be missed.

title: Not as good as the first two but was still great
text: Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire(2024) is the newest and probably the last Ghostbusters movie and i gotta say i didnt expect to like this one since Ghostbusters:afterlife wasnt all that good but this one is a step up ,While its definitly not better than the first two GhostBusters movies but this one atleast was kinda enjoyable , had good pacing but the new characters are not my favorite thing about them , theyre cliche and sometimes not that funny but DON'T GET ME WRONG i do not have anything agianst the actors but comparing them to the old and AMAZING crew they could've been betterthe story here is great not the best but i think that the Sound effects and CGI was very well done that was very great from the people that worked in thisbut my FAVORITE part is that the old crew is once agian BACK!! Peter Venkman ,Raymond , and Winston those are SUCH AN AMAZING people! Well respected actors absolutely AMAZING to see them again in this movie that was the absolute BEST PART about this movie and i gotta say it was definitely a very VERY good thing seeing them agian but unfortunately Harold Ramis died in 2014 Rip he was a good actor.But overall i didnt really expect to like it while watching the first hour and a half but the last scene was great 8/10.
